903.01 REMOVING STONE, EARTH OR GRAVEL.
   No person, without permission of the City Engineer, shall remove or carry
away, or cause to be removed or carried away, any stone, earth, sand or gravel
from any street, alley or public ground, for any purpose whatsoever, unless
such person is employed for that purpose by the City.
(1964 Code § 519.02)
903.02 DISCHARGE OF WATER FROM PREMISES.
   No person shall allow to be discharged from the premises of such person, the
water from any fountain, sink or pipe from any building, or the storm water
runoff from parking lots or driveways, upon the surface of any part of any
sidewalk, street or public ground within the City, when in the opinion of the
City Engineer a public nuisance is caused by so doing. The City Engineer may,
when in his judgment it is necessary, notify any person not to allow water to
be discharged upon any sidewalk, street or other public ground in violation of
this section.
(Ord. 51-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
903.03 OBSTRUCTION WITH BUILDING MATERIALS; PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall place or cause to be placed on or in any street, sidewalk,
lane, alley or public sidewalk or public ground any material for building
purposes until he has obtained a permit to do so from the Building Inspection
Department. The permit shall be permission to occupy that portion of sidewalk,
street, lane, alley or public ground necessary for the storage of building
materials during construction of or remodeling of a structure and not in
conflict with any other provisions of Chapter
903. All such permits shall be reported to the Director of Public Safety at
least forty-eight hours prior to such occupation so that any necessary safety
precautions may be taken.
(Ord. 346-76. Passed 8-30-76.)
903.04 WARNING LANTERNS FOR OBSTRUCTIONS.
   Every person receiving a permit as required by Section
903.03 shall, from the time of placing any material upon any street, sidewalk,
lane, alley or public ground, place, keep and maintain at his expense at or
near such material, not fewer than two signal lanterns and as many more as
shall be necessary, and shall keep the same lighted so that the material or
obstructions so placed can at all times or hours of the night be seen by
persons passing or near such material or obstructions, and such signal lanterns
shall be kept lighted every night from dusk until daylight the next day, as
long as any material or obstructions so placed remain there.
(1964 Code §519.19)
 
903.05 BUILDING MATERIALS NOT TO INTERFERE WITH FREE FLOW OF WATER.
   Material for building purposes permitted to be placed upon any street, lane,
alley or public ground as provided in Section
903.03 shall be so located as to not interfere with the free flow of water upon
any street, lane, alley or public ground.
(1964 Code §519.20)
903.06 COVERED PASSAGEWAY REQUIRED FOR ERECTION OR ALTERATION OF WALLS ON
CERTAIN STREETS; MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS.
   Before the wall of any building abutting upon parts of any street between
Sixth Street on the north and Sixth Street on the south, and between Shorb
Avenue on the west and Cherry Avenue on the east, both sides of all above-named
streets, inclusive, shall be erected or taken down or altered, a coverage
passageway shall be constructed between the curb line and the property line not
less than five feet in width, and shall be kept free and clear from any
obstructions, and shall be kept open for free and uninterrupted use by
pedestrians. The passageway shall be enclosed by a proper and sufficient
covering, the roof of which shall be at least eight feet from the surface of
the sidewalk. The sides and roof shall be of sufficiently heavy construction to
protect pedestrians from any falling building or other material, the sides to
be composed of not less than four inch by four inch standards, nor more than
eight feet from center to center, with a handrail on the side nearest the
middle of the street and the side next to the building covered with material of
not less than seven-eighths of an inch in thickness and the roof composed of
material not less than one and three-fourths inches in thickness. No
advertising of any kind shall be placed on such covered passageway.
(1964 Code §519.21)
903.07 VISION CLEARANCE OF SHRUBBERY.
   (a)    No person, being the owner, tenant or otherwise in control of or
having legal responsibility for any real property, shall have or permit on any
lot, vegetation of any nature, to include, but not limited to bushes,
shrubbery, hedges, evergreens, trees, plants, grass or weeds, which shall in
any manner obstruct the safe view of a driver of a vehicle to traffic at any
intersection.
   (b)   The owner, tenant or other person otherwise in control of or having
legal responsibility for any real property shall be responsible for the removal
of any vegetation on his property which shall in any manner obstruct the safe
view of a driver of a vehicle to traffic at any intersection.
   (c)    Property owners must trim all vegetation within the intersection
sight triangle to a height no greater than three feet high. The intersection
sight triangle and intersection sight distance specifications shall be based
upon the most current version of the ODOT Location and Design Manual, Vol. 1, -
Roadway Design.
   (d)    If the Director of Public Safety determines that there is a violation
of Section
903.07, the Director will order the property owner to correct the condition
within ten days, and that if they do not, then Canton will do so at the
property owner's expense. The order will also inform the property owner of
their right to appear under paragraph (g), and the potential penalties under
Section
903.99.
   (e)    If any owner, tenant or person otherwise in control of or having
legal responsibility for any real property, fails to comply with the provisions
of this section, the Director of Public Safety, or his/her designee, shall
effect the removal of any offending vegetation from the property which
obstructs the safe view of a driver of a vehicle to traffic at any
intersection. For such purpose, the Director may employ city employees or a
private entity.
   (f)    All expenses effecting the removal of any offending vegetation
pursuant to this section, including the costs of inspection, record search,
notification and billing, so incurred by the city, shall be recorded by the
Director of Public Safety, or designee, who shall also mail a statement thereof
to the owner of such land if a current address is known. If after thirty days
the amount remains unpaid, Council, by ordinance shall certify the total amount
of the expenses, the name of the owner of the land, and a sufficient
description of the premises, to the County Auditor to be entered upon the tax
duplicate to be lien upon such land from the date of entry, and to be as other
taxes and assessments and returned to the appropriate fund.
   (g)    Any person affected by an order under Section
903.07 or an assessment hereunder may file an appeal with the Director of
Public Safety no later than 30 days after the date of the order or assessment.
The appeal must include the appellant's name, address, phone number, and. a
brief statement of the grounds for the appeal. The Director must set a time for
a hearing when the appellant will be given an opportunity to be heard and show
cause why the order or assessment should be modified or dismissed. The Director
may affirm, modify, or dismiss the order or assessment. If the appellant fails
to appear, the Director may dismiss the appeal.
(Ord. 87-2018. Passed 4-16-18.)
903.08 PERMIT TO ERECT POLES.
   No public utility doing business in the City, or any of its officers, agents
or employees, shall place or cause to be placed, service poles in any of the
streets of the City without having first obtained the written permission of the
Director of Public Service as to the location of poles already in the streets
as well as to the installation of new poles.
(1964 Code §519.60)
903.09 UTILITY POLE IDENTIFICATION.
   All utility companies and other persons erecting or maintaining poles upon
the public streets, sidewalks or other public places shall paint or stencil
such poles with the name of the company, firm or person owning or operating
such pole, in a plain and legible manner. Such painting or stenciling shall be
kept at all times in such a condition that it can be plainly read.
(1964 Code §519.61)
903.10 ASSESSMENTS AGAINST CORNER LOTS IN RESIDENTIAL AREAS.
   The City Engineer shall calculate all assessments against corner lots in
residential districts in accordance with the following plan:
   (a)    In residential districts under the Zoning Code where the size of the
lot is such that the Zoning Code prohibits the erection of more than one
dwelling, the assessment for paving or repaving a roadway shall be calculated
for forty percent of the foot frontage of the long or side dimension of the lot
and the remaining sixty percent shall be added to the City's share of the cost
of the improvement.
   (b)    Where the lot in a residential section under the Zoning Code has
sufficient area for the erection of two or more dwellings under the Zoning
Code, the assessment for paving or repaving a roadway shall be calculated for
sixty percent of the foot frontage of the long or side dimension of the lot and
the remaining forty percent shall be added to the City's share of the cost of
the improvement.
      (1964 Code §213.07)
903.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a
minor misdemeanor and fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00).
 
   (b)    If a permit has been issued pursuant to Section
903.03 through
903.05 it shall be revoked at the discretion of the Director of Public Service
and it shall be the duty of the Director of Public Service and police to
prevent the placing of any building material or other matter upon any street,
lane, alley or public ground, except in accordance with a permit issued under
this chapter, and to cause the removal of any material placed thereon without
such permit.
(Ord. 158-79. Passed 5-14-79.)
CHAPTER 905
Construction of Sidewalks and Curbs
905.01   Owner to repair; notice; work by City; costs a lien.
905.02   Sidewalk area.
905.03   Fees for setting grade.
905.04   Construction and material specification.
905.05   City to relay sidewalks improperly constructed.
905.06   Changing or lowering curb line or grade.
905.07   Grading of space between walks and curb line.
905.08   Construction of sidewalks and curbs required.
905.09   Enforcement.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Construction or repair at owner's expense - see Ohio R.C. 729.01 et seq.
Notice to construct or repair sidewalks - see Ohio R.C. 729.03 et seq.
 
905.01 OWNER TO REPAIR; NOTICE; WORK BY CITY; COSTS A LIEN.
   (a)   It shall be the duty of owners of lots abutting on sidewalks and curbs
to keep such sidewalks and curbs, and also the tree lawn or grass strip
existing between any sidewalks and curbs, in a state of good repair and safe
condition in front of or adjacent to their premises, and to further prevent the
existence of any nuisance or hazard to persons or property upon such tree lawns
or grass strips arising by any reason whatsoever, including the criteria
specified in Section
919.03. It shall be the duty and responsibility of the Civil Engineering
Department to inspect the City’s sidewalks upon receipt of a complaint. It
shall be the duty of the Clerk of Council to first cause notice to be given to
the owner of the premises abutting upon such sidewalks, curbs, grass strips or
tree lawns of any necessary repairs or improvements required to be made
pursuant to this section.
   (b)   If such owner does not, within thirty-one days after notice to do so,
weather permitting, make the necessary repairs or improvements to such
sidewalks, curbs, tree lawns or grass strips, Council, upon resolution, shall
notify the property owner of its intent to make the necessary repairs and shall
thereafter, if repairs are not made within five days after the service of
notice of the resolution, authorize the Director of Public Service to make the
necessary repairs and improvements, and further direct that the expense of such
repairs or improvements shall be assessed upon the property so abutting and
certify to the County Auditor for collection in the manner of other taxes and
assessment against real estate.
   (c)   Such assessments shall be credited by the proper City officials to the
County Auditor; and such assessment shall act as a lien upon the property
assessed and shall be collected as provided for in the case of other special
assessments against real estate.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.02 SIDEWALK AREA.
   (a)   All sidewalks shall be under the direction and supervision of the City
Engineer. The space between the property line and curb line on each side of the
paved roadway on curbed streets shall constitute the sidewalk. Upon unpaved and
uncurbed streets, the sidewalk shall be the portion adjoining the property line
on each side, and shall have a width equal to one-fifth of the distance between
the property lines, unless otherwise provided by resolution of Council. On
streets or alleys having a width of eighteen feet, the sidewalk space shall be
three feet wide, but no sidewalks shall be provided for streets or alleys less
than eighteen feet in width, unless specifically provided by Council.
   (b)   The width of the improved walk shall be as follows: On all streets
thirty feet or more in width the walk shall be at least five feet in width, and
on all streets or alleys less than thirty feet in width, such width shall be as
may be determined by the City Engineer. On all streets and alleys, the
sidewalks shall be of uniform width. In business or industrial districts, the
sidewalks shall be of uniform width and of the entire sidewalk space unless
otherwise waived by the City Engineer.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.03 FEES FOR SETTING GRADE.
   (a)   Any person desiring the determination of a grade of any sidewalk or
street by the City Engineer shall make application with the fee charges
indicated herein. If a second or additional determination of grade is
necessary, the same shall be regarded as a new application and shall be
accompanied by the required fees.
   (b)   When grade stakes are to be set for the determination of a street
grade only, and no street line is to be established, a fee of ten cents (10¢)
per lineal foot shall be charged, with a minimum charge of ten dollars ($10.00)
per lot for each survey.
   (c)   When grade stakes are to be set for curb or sidewalks, where a
definite line and grade is to be determined, a fee of twenty cents (20¢) per
lineal foot shall be charged with a minimum charge of twenty dollars ($20.00)
per lot for each survey.
   (d)   When stakes are to be set for street lines only, the following fees
shall be charged:
   For an interior lot with one frontage, twenty cents (20¢) per foot or part
thereof;
   For an interior lot with two frontages, eighteen cents (18¢) per foot or
part thereof;
   For a corner lot with three frontages, sixteen cents (16¢) per foot or part
thereof; and
   For an open lot with four frontages, fourteen cents (14¢) per foot or part
thereof.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.04 CONSTRUCTION AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATION.
   All construction and materials for sidewalks/curbs shall be under the
direction and approval of the City Engineer based on City standard drawings and
material specifications.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.05 CITY TO RELAY SIDEWALKS IMPROPERLY CONSTRUCTED.
   The Director of Public Service shall upon being notified that any sidewalk
is being or has been constructed contrary to the provisions of this chapter
direct the Superintendent of Streets to immediately remove such sidewalk and
relay the same. The expense thereof shall be assessed upon the premises
abutting upon the sidewalk, and such costs and expense shall be credited to the
proper officials, to be placed upon the tax duplicate for collection as
provided by law.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.06 CHANGING OR LOWERING CURB LINE OR GRADE.
   No curb line or curb grade shall be changed, nor shall any curb be lowered
or any portion thereof removed, except by the direction and the written consent
of the City Engineer.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.07 GRADING OF SPACE BETWEEN WALKS AND CURB LINE.
   Any grading necessary between the walks as laid or relaid, and the curb
line, or between such walks and the edge of the sidewalk space as established,
shall be done at the time of the laying of the walks so as to leave the
sidewalk space at the grade meeting City standards.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.08 CONSTRUCTION OF SIDEWALKS AND CURBS REQUIRED.
   All special assessment and general projects constructed in the City after
the effective date of this section which involve the construction or
reconstruction of streets, sidewalks and curbs in part or in whole shall
require the construction of sidewalks and curbs on both sides of the
improvement the entire length of the project. (Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
905.09 ENFORCEMENT.
   The provisions of this chapter may be enforced by the Director of Public
Service or his designee, as well as any and all other designated officials and/
or law enforcement officers.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
CHAPTER 907
Sidewalk/Curb Contractors
907.01   License; fee.
907.02   License expiration date.
907.03   Bond; conditions.
907.04   Permit required for each job.
907.05   Exemptions.
907.99    Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Barricades and warning lights - see GEN. OFF.
521.03
Sidewalk construction - see S. U. & P. S. Ch.
905
 
 
907.01 LICENSE; FEE.
   No person shall engage in the work of laying, relaying or repairing
sidewalks/curbs on any street or alley until he has been licensed by the City
Engineer to do so. Application for such license shall be filed with and
approved by the City Engineer. The City Engineer shall issue the license on
payment of an annual license fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) and the license may
be renewed each year upon payment of the same fee. The application for the
license shall state the experience of the applicant in sidewalk work. (Ord. 59-
2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
907.02 LICENSE EXPIRATION DATE.
   Sidewalk/curb contractors’ licenses shall expire annually on November 1.
(Ord. 59-2001. Passed 4-9-01.)
907.03 BOND; CONDITIONS.
   Prior to being licensed as a sidewalk contractor, the applicant shall file a
bond in the sum of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) by a good and reliable surety
company to the approval of the Director of Public Service or City Engineer.
Such bond shall be conditioned that the City shall be saved harmless from any
loss or expenditure in any manner arising from the conduct of the licensee, his
agents or employees engaged in sidewalk work and from any loss or damage which
may arise by reason of any excavation, obstruction, barriers, guards or other
obstruction or material placed or deposited upon the street or sidewalk during
the progress of the work, and the cost and expense of removing the same and the
cleaning of sidewalk or street or both and from any loss or damage arising from
any acts, negligence or default of such licensee, his agents or employees, and
conditioned further that the sidewalks so laid, relaid or repaired, shall
remain in good condition to the satisfaction of the Director for a full period
of one year from the date of the laying, relaying or repairing of such
sidewalk. Such bond shall be further conditioned that such licensee shall
immediately, upon the appearance of any defect, disintegration or faults in
such sidewalk, and due to any acts, omissions or defaults of the licensee
laying the same, repair and restore to good and proper condition to the
satisfaction of the Director, if any such defects appear at any time within the
full period of one year from the date of laying, relaying or repairing the
sidewalk. Such bond shall cover all of the foregoing matters which may arise or
be occasioned at any time within one year after such work is done.
(Ord. 5 l-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
907.04 PERMIT REQUIRED FOR EACH JOB.
   (a)    Before any person, who is entitled to engage in the laying, relaying
or repairing of sidewalks undertakes to do any sidewalk work, he shall have
made application for and procured from the City Engineer a permit for a fee of
five dollars ($5.00). The application shall specify the house number, lot
number, street name, location between intersecting streets, owner's name,
length of walk or curb to be constructed, width of walk and location of walk
with reference to curb line. One permit may include the laying, relaying or
repairing of a sidewalk or curb in front of two or more adjoining lots provided
the same are named in the permit; otherwise, a separate permit must be secured
for each lot or part thereof.
   (b)   Before the expiration of ten days after the securing of such permit,
the contractor shall begin work on such contract and prosecute the same without
delay. After the subgrade is prepared and before laying the foundation material
or placing the concrete or stone curb or walk, the contractor shall notify the
office of the City Engineer at least six hours in advance of his intention to
proceed with the work. A representative of the office of the City Engineer
shall inspect the foundation and materials to be used. Such foundation or
materials that do not fulfill the requirements of the specifications will be
rejected, and must be removed from the site, and proper materials provided
before the work will be allowed to proceed.
   (c)   All permits issued under this section shall be void after the
expiration of thirty days from the date of such permit.
(Ord. 51-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
907.05 EXEMPTIONS.
   The provisions of Sections
907.01 to
907.04 shall not be held to govern the laying, relaying or repairing of
sidewalks with the City, which have been duly advertised, bids received and
contracts entered into in accordance with special legislation passed by
Council.
(1964 Code §519.49)
907.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00).
CHAPTER 909
Excavations
909.01   Definitions.
909.02   Excavations, permit required; exception.
909.03   Excavation permit fees; restoration.
909.04   Excavations by public utilities; permit; inspection; inspection fee;
deposit.
909.05   Supports for sides of excavations in excess of five feet.
909.06   Warning lanterns for excavations.
909.07   Refilling excavations; resurfacing.
909.08   Information needed to operate excavation machinery.
909.09   Exemption.
909.10   Crosswalks during repairs.
909.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Liability for damage - see Ohio R.C. 723.49
Digging, excavating and piling earth on streets - see Ohio R.C. 5589.10
Manhole safety - see GEN. OFF.
521.15 
 
909.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Unimproved street" means a street without any surface improvement.
   (b)    “Improved street” means a street with an added surface by
stabilization such as asphalt, soil, cement, oil or any bituminous application.
   (c)    "Paved street" means a street surface laid on concrete, sand, crushed
slag or gravel, or a street constructed of sheet asphalt, asphaltic concrete or
resurface of sheet asphalt or asphaltic concrete over brick or a street of
entire concrete construction. (1964 Code §519.50)
909.02 EXCAVATIONS, PERMIT REQUIRED; EXCEPTION.
No person, other than a proper duly authorized officer of the City, shall make
any opening or excavation in any sidewalk, street, alley or public ground
without a permit to do so. Any such person desiring an excavation permit shall
file with the City Engineer a written application setting forth the location,
kind, number and size excavation to be made, and the time during which such
excavation is to remain open. These provisions shall not apply where openings
are made for public use by the City or by contractors performing work pursuant
to City contracts.
(1964 Code §519.51)
909.03 EXCAVATION PERMIT FEES; RESTORATION.
   (a)   The City Engineer shall, upon the filing of an application for an
excavation permit, investigate the same, and if he deems it necessary, he shall
issue a permit authorizing the permit holder to make excavations at the places
specified.
   (b)   Fees for excavation permits are:
      (1)    Thirty-five dollars ($35.00) if the opening or excavation is to be
made in an unimproved street.
      (2)    Thirty-five dollars ($35.00) if the opening or excavation is to be
made in a resurfaced, stabilized or paved street.
      (3)    Five dollars ($5.00) if the excavation requires the removal of any
sidewalk.
   (c)   At the time of completing any such excavation, the applicant shall
restore the street to its original condition and shall remain responsible for
the condition of the street surface for a period of ninety days thereafter,
until it is ascertained that the excavation is stabilized.
   (d)   In the event the applicant fails to properly restore the street, the
Director of Public Service is authorized to accomplish proper restoration and
the applicant shall be responsible for the payment of the cost thereof to the
City.
(Ord. 51-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
909.04 EXCAVATIONS BY PUBLIC UTILITIES; PERMIT; INSPECTION; INSPECTION FEE;
DEPOSIT.
   Any utility company, which is occupying and using the streets, alleys or
public grounds of the City, under a valid franchise, before making any
excavation in any of the streets, alleys or public grounds, shall first file an
application for a permit as provided for in Sections
909.02 and
909.03. If the permit is granted the Director of Public Service shall direct
one of the regularly appointed inspectors of the City to supervise and inspect
the making of such excavation and the refilling or repaving of the same. Such
work must be done in the manner directed by the inspector. The company to whom
the permit was granted shall pay to the City the cost of such supervision and
excavation and inspection which shall not exceed the sum of one hundred forty
dollars ($140.00) per day for each inspector employed from the time the
excavation is started until it is permanently completed, or ninety-five dollars
($95.00) for any part thereof less than half a day. Each of the companies shall
maintain a deposit with the City Engineer of not less than one thousand five
hundred dollars ($1,500) to be used by the Director of Public Service in
payment of the inspection provided for in this section, and the Director shall
issue no permits to any of the within named companies which fails to maintain
such deposit.
(Ord. 51-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
909.05 SUPPORTS FOR SIDES OF EXCAVATIONS IN EXCESS OF FIVE FEET.
   (a)   No person shall excavate any sewer or trench to a greater depth than
five feet unless the sides of such trench or sewer excavated are supported by
proper cribbing strong enough to prevent the earth from caving or falling in.
   (b)    In each contract on behalf of the City for the construction of sewers
or trenches, it shall be stipulated in such contract that excavations to a
greater depth than five feet, must be supported by proper cribbing. (1964 Code
§519.54)
909.06 WARNING LANTERNS FOR EXCAVATIONS.
   All persons making excavations in any streets, alleys or public grounds
shall place, keep and maintain at his expense, at or near such excavation, not
less than two signal lanterns and as many more as shall be necessary, and shall
keep the same lighted at all hours of the night so that the excavation may be
seen by any person passing along or near the excavation. The signal lanterns
shall be kept lighted every night from dusk until daylight the next day, so
long as the excavation remains open. (1964 Code §519.55)
909.07 REFlLLlNG EXCAVATIONS; RESURFACING.
   Any person making an excavation in any street, alley or public ground shall
immediately, upon having completed the work for which such excavation is made,
refill such opening, or excavation and restore the road surface in compliance
with plans and specifications on file in the City Engineer’s office or as
directed by the City Engineer.
(Ord. 51-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
909.08 INFORMATION NEEDED TO OPERATE EXCAVATION MACHINERY.
   No person shall operate a powered shovel or excavating machinery without
having first obtained from the City Electrician written information showing the
location of any underground wiring, cables and conduits owned by the City or by
any utility doing business in the City located within the intended zone of
operation of such steam shovel.
(1964 Code §519.57)
909.09 EXEMPTION.
   The provisions of Sections
909.02 through
909.08 shall not apply to persons making excavations for or under the
provisions of a valid contract entered into between them and the City, for the
purpose of constructing sewers or other street improvements.
(1964 Code §519.58)
909.10 CROSSWALKS DURING REPAIRS.
   Every person making excavation in any public street for the purpose of
improving or repairing the roadway of such street shall, during the progress of
the work, provide crosswalks on that portion of the street being improved or
repaired for the purpose of accommodating pedestrians who may desire to cross
such street. Such crosswalks shall be constructed of planks at least five feet
in length, and within the fire limits of the City such crosswalks shall be at
least five feet in width, and outside the fire limits at least three feet in
width.
(1964 Code §519.17)
909.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter for which no other
penalty is specified shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars
($100.00). (Adopting Ordinance)
   (b)   Whoever violates any provision of 909.08 shall be fined not more than
five hundred dollars ($500.00).
(1964 Code §519.99)
CHAPTER 911
Driveways
911.01   Construction permit.
911.02   Specifications.
911.03   Removal of driveways not in use; reconstruction of curbs.
911.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Barricades and warning lights - see GEN. OFF.
521.03
 
911.01 CONSTRUCTION PERMIT.
   No person shall construct or improve, or cause to be constructed or
improved, any driveway or driveway approach from a public street or
thoroughfare to private property, without first having made application and
having received a permit from the City Engineer, the cost of which permit, if
issued, shall be five dollars ($5.00) to the applicant.
(Ord. 51-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
911.02 SPECIFICATIONS.
   Driveways or driveway approaches hereafter constructed or improved shall be
constructed in accordance with the following specifications:
   (a)    Where there is a lawn strip between the curb and the paved portion of
the sidewalk, any inclined portion of the driveway or approach shall be
constructed in the lawn strip area only, and the established grade of the paved
portion of the sidewalk shall not be changed in any manner.
   (b)    Where the paved portion of the sidewalk immediately adjoins the curb,
and no lawn strip exists, the inclined portion of the driveway or approach
shall be constructed to extend upon the sidewalk and curb not in excess of
forty percent of the combined width of the paved portion of such sidewalk and
curb, but in no event shall the inclined portion of such driveway or approach
exceed three feet; the established grade of the remaining part of the paved
portion of the sidewalk shall not be changed in any manner.
   (c)    Such driveway approaches or inclines and the space intervening
between the driveway approaches or inclines shall be of such width as in the
opinion of the City Engineer should be suitable under the circumstances of each
particular case, but in no case shall it be lawful to construct any driveway
leading into the street through and across a circular curb previously
established and put into place by the City.
   (d)   Each driveway construction permit issued shall stipulate the width of
the driveway approach or incline, the number to be installed, and if more than
one driveway approach or incline, the width of the space between the same.
      (Ord. 51-90. Passed 3-5-90.)
911.03 REMOVAL OF DRIVEWAYS NOT IN USE; RECONSTRUCTION OF CURBS.
   A driveway approach or incline leading into a street, which is not being
used as a driveway approach or incline either through change of circumstances,
relocation of buildings or for any other reason, is hereby declared to be a
nuisance and shall be removed. A sidewalk and curb shall be constructed there
by the owner of the property abutting such sidewalk within thirty days of
receipt of notice from the City Engineer that such nuisance exists. Failure to
comply with such notice is a violation of this section and failure to comply in
each five-day period thereafter shall be considered a separate offense. (1964
Code §519.67)
911.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00).
(1964 Code §519.99)
CHAPTER 913
Numbering of Buildings
913.01   Assigning numbers; size and material.
913.02   Front footage per number.
913.03   Legibility and location.
913.04   Numbering plan by direction.
913.05   City Engineer to assign numbers.
913.06   Duty of owner of building to number.
913.07   Damaging; wrong numbers.
913.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Power to regulate building numbering - see Ohio R.C. 715.26
 
913.01 ASSIGNING NUMBERS; SIZE AND MATERIAL.
   All houses and buildings on any streets, avenues, alleys, or fronting on any
public place of the City, shall be numbered according to the street numbering
plats made for the City by the City Engineer and now on file in his office, and
as may be hereafter made and prepared. Numbers shall be assigned to all such
houses and buildings by the City Engineer in accordance with such street
numbering plats. Such numbers shall be placed on such buildings as hereinafter
provided. Numbers shall be neatly painted, stamped or enameled upon zinc,
japanned tin, iron or other suitable material and shall be not less than three
inches by two inches in size. However, any person shall have the right to
number his house or building in an ornamental manner.
(1964 Code §519.75)
913.02 FRONT FOOTAGE PER NUMBER.
   The front footage allotted to each number shall be as follows: in the
territory bounded by Sixth Street on the south and Sixth Street on the north,
Savannah Avenue on the east, and Wells Avenue on the west, each number shall
occupy or be applied to ten feet of space. In all other parts of the City
outside of this territory, each number shall occupy or be applied to a space of
twenty feet along each street on which the house or building abuts.
(1964 Code 519.76)
913.03 LEGIBILITY AND LOCATION.
   The figures of every number shall be distinct and legible and shall be
placed on the side of or immediately upon the front door or other conspicuous
place of each building and in full view of the street. (1964 Code §519.77)
913.04 NUMBERING PLAN BY DIRECTION.
   All streets of the City running east and west shall be numbered east from
Market Avenue eastwardly and west from Market Avenue westwardly, with odd
numbers on the north side and even numbers on the south side of such streets.
All streets running north and south shall be numbered south from Tuscarawas
Street southwardly and north from Tuscarawas Street northwardly, with the odd
numbers on the west and even numbers on the east side of such streets. (1964
Code §519.78)
913.05 CITY ENGINEER TO ASSIGN NUMBERS.
   The City Engineer is hereby required to divide up the different lots and
blocks required to be numbered, which are not provided for on such numbering
maps referred to in Section
913.01, in the manner provided for in Sections
913.01 to
913.04 into the proper spaces and affix to each of such spaces the proper
number and add and attach the same to the numbering maps or plats now on file
in the Engineer's office. (1964 Code §519.79)
913.06 DUTY OF OWNER OF BUILDING TO NUMBER.
   It shall be the duty of the owner, occupant, lessee or agent of any owner of
buildings, contemplated in Sections
913.01 to
913.05, to cause such buildings to be numbered as herein provided for within
thirty days after receiving notice from the City Engineer to do so.
(1964 Code §519.80)
913.07 DAMAGING; WRONG NUMBERS.
   No person in any manner shall interfere with the affixing of any number to
any building or remove, destroy, alter or deface any number of any building
assigned and put up thereon. No person, after having received the notice
provided for in Section
913.06, shall retain an improper number or substitute any other number on his
building other than the numbers assigned in the manner provided for in this
chapter. (1964 Code §519.81)
913.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provisions of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00).
CHAPTER 915
Moving of Buildings
