1301.01 QUALIFICATIONS OF CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL.
   To be eligible to appointment the Chief Building Official shall have had
experience as or be a registered architect, registered engineer or have been a
building contractor or superintendent of construction within the last ten
years, with at least five years of general experience in building construction.
He shall be generally informed on the quality and strength of building
construction, on the prevailing methods of building construction, on good
practice in fire prevention, and on the accepted requirements for safe exit
facilities. He shall be in good health physically capable of making the
necessary examination and inspections of building in the course of
construction. He shall not have any interest whatever, directly or indirectly,
in the sale or manufacture of any material process or device entering into or
used in or in connection with building construction.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.02 AUTHORITY OF CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL.
   (a)    The Building Code invests the Chief Building Official with the
authority and responsibility to administer and enforce all laws controlling
safe building construction and all other applicable laws and regulations
dealing with the planning, construction, use or maintenance of buildings or
structures. He is authorized and directed to enforce all provisions of the City
Building Code when they have been adopted by Council and has the authority to
enter any building or premises for the purpose of inspection or for the
prevention of violations. If the Chief Building Official’s orders are not
complied with, he has the authority to proceed with the appropriate legal
action. If work is being done, or a condition exists which constitutes
immediate danger to the public, he has the authority to take immediate steps
for the removal of the unsafe conditions without court action.
   (b)   For authority of Plumbing Inspector, refer to Chapter
1315.
   (c)   For authority of Electrical Inspector, refer to Chapter
1313.
   (d)   For authority of Warm Air Heating Inspector, refer to Chapter
1317.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.03 INSPECTION OF INDUSTRIALIZED STRUCTURES AND METHODS OUTSIDE THE CITY.
   (a)    The various inspectors of the Building Department are authorized to
travel outside of the City limits to inspect different buildings, houses,
material and equipment including methods of construction, plumbing, electrical
and heating used that are being manufactured for the erection within the City
limits. Expenses involved by the different inspectors traveling to and from the
factory constructing such building units shall be paid in advance by the
companies requesting such inspections.
   (b)   Such inspections are to be made by the various inspectors of the
Building Department to determine whether such construction of buildings and
houses, including equipment and material, electrical, plumbing and heating
units meet the requirements of the City Building Code. (Ord. 216-69. Passed 8-
18-69)
1301.04  RESERVED.
   EDITOR’S NOTE: This section is reserved for future legislation.
1301.05 PERMIT ISSUANCE.
   The Chief Building Official, or his designee shall issue all permits for the
erection, repair, remodeling, erecting and shoring of building; all permits for
plumbing work; all permits for electrical work, and all permits for the
installation of any warm air heating equipment or appurtenances; when, in the
opinion of the Chief Building Official, or his designee, the ordinances,
Building Code, Board of Health rules and regulations, and State laws have been
fully complied with.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.06 STOP WORK ORDER.
   Whenever the provisions of the City Building Code or of the plans and
specifications approved thereunder are not complied with, the Chief Building
Official may issue a stop work order against the owner or his representative.
Such stop work order cannot be removed except by written notice of the Chief
Building Official after satisfactory evidence has been supplied that the
violation has been corrected (Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.07 CIVIL PROCEEDINGS.
   Whenever the Chief Building Official or any other officer charged with the
enforcement of the Building Code is satisfied that any provision he is charged
to enforce has been violated or is about to be violated in any respect, or that
any order or direction made in pursuance of the enforcement of the Building
Code has not been complied with, or is being disregarded, and whenever he is
satisfied that civil proceedings are necessary for the enforcement thereof, or
to prevent the occupancy or use of any residential building that is being
constructed, altered, or maintained in violation of this Building Code, he
shall apply to the City Law Director who is hereby authorized to institute
civil proceedings. Such civil proceedings shall be brought in the name of the
City. However, nothing in this section and no action taken thereunder shall be
held to exclude such criminal proceedings as may be authorized under the Ohio
Revised Code, or any of the laws in force to exempt anyone violating this
Building Code or any part of such laws from any penalty which may be incurred.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.08 VIOLATIONS.
   (a)   No person, being the owner or having control of any building, shall
violate any regulation, provision, amendment or supplement of this Building
Code, or fail to obey any lawful order of the Chief Building Official issued in
pursuance thereof. Each day during which such person continues to violate any
regulation, provision, amendment or supplement of this Building Code shall be
deemed a separate offense.
   (b)   No architect, engineer, contractor, building subcontractor or other
person shall assist in the violation of any regulation, provision, amendment or
supplement of this Building Code, or of any certificate, order or permit issued
thereunder.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.09 RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   (a)   The Chief Building Official and the officers and employees of the
Building Department, or persons authorized by such department, upon
presentation of proper credentials and having obtained consent from the
property owner or tenant in possession, may enter at reasonable times or such
other times as may be necessary, any structure, dwelling, premises or building
site, or upon property or structures alleged to be unsafe or in a nuisance
condition, for the purpose of making inspections and performing their duties.
   (b)   If acting pursuant to actual or apparent emergency conditions, such
persons described in subsection (a) hereof may so enter without first obtaining
consent of the property owner or tenant in possession.
   (c)   If consent for entry or inspection cannot be obtained, or if for any
other reason an inspector is unable to enter or obtain free access to a
structure for the purpose of inspection, the inspector may apply to a court of
competent jurisdiction for an administrative inspection warrant pursuant to
Section
1301.20 or other court order, or the inspector may make the inspection in any
other manner authorized by law.
(Ord. 39-95. Passed 3-20-95.)
1301.10 INSPECTION OF STRUCTURES AND EQUIPMENT.
   (a)   When a structure or any appurtenances or parts thereof of a building
is a danger to life or property, it shall be the duty of the Chief Building
Official , upon finding any of the things hereinbefore enumerated to be
defective or in a dangerous condition, or being constructed in violation of the
Building Code, to cause to be delivered to the owner, lessee or occupant,
written instructions to remove or remedy the same in such manner and within
such reasonable time as may be necessary.
   (b)   Whenever, in the opinion of the Chief Building Official, by reason of
defective or illegal work in violation of a provision or requirement of the
Building Code or the continuance of a building operation is contrary to public
welfare, he may order in writing, suspension of work relating to the violation
until the condition in violation has been remedied.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.11 UNSAFE BUILDINGS OR STRUCTURES TO BE REMOVED OR REPAIRED.
   (a)   A building or structure that may be or shall at any time become an
unsafe building or structure, unless made safe and secure shall be taken down
and removed when so ordered by the Chief Building Official.
   (b)   If the person responsible for the violation fails to remove or remedy
the same, it shall be the further duty of the Chief Building Official to cause
proceedings to be instituted to enjoin the continuance of use thereof.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.12 NOTICE OF UNSAFE BUILDING.
   (a)   Upon receipt of information that a building or structure is unsafe,
the Chief Building Official shall make or cause to be made an inspection. If it
is found that an unsafe condition exists, he shall serve or cause to be served
on the owner, or some one of the owner, executors, administrators, agents,
lessees or other persons who may have a vested or contingent interest in the
same, a written notice containing the address and a description of the building
or structure deemed unsafe, a statement of the particulars in which the
building or structure is unsafe, and an order requiring, within a stated time,
the same to be made safe and secure or removed, as may be deemed necessary by
him.
   (b)   If the person to whom such notice and order is addressed cannot be
found after diligent search, then such notice and order shall be sent, by
certified mail, to the last known address of such person, and a copy of such
notice shall be posted in a conspicuous place on the premises to which it
relates. Such mailing and posting shall be deemed adequate service.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.13 VACATING UNSAFE BUILDINGS AND CLOSING STREETS.
   (a)    When the Chief Building Official is of the opinion that a building or
structure is in an unsafe condition so that life is endangered thereby, he may
order and require the inmates and occupants to vacate such building or
structure forthwith.
   (b)   He shall cause to be posted at each entrance to such building a notice
to read as follows:
"THIS BUILDING IS UNSAFE AND ITS USE OR OCCUPANCY HAS BEEN PROHIBITED BY THE
CITY CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL."
   Such notice shall remain posted until the required repairs are made or until
the building or structure is razed. It shall be unlawful for any person, other
than an employee of the Building Department properly authorized to do so, to
remove or cause to be removed such notice without written permission from the
Chief Building Official.
   (c)    It shall be unlawful for any person, other than those authorized by
law, to enter a building or structure which has been posted as unsafe for the
use or occupancy by the Chief Building Official, except for the purpose of
making the required repairs or of demolishing such building or structure, or
authorized utility company representatives to remove utility equipment.
   (d)   The Chief Building Official may, when necessary for public safety,
temporarily close sidewalks, streets, buildings, structures and places adjacent
to such buildings or structures, and prohibit the same from being used. Notice
of any temporary closing of streets, sidewalks or building, shall be properly
posted, however, in case of an emergency such notice may be waived.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.14 DISREGARD OF NOTICE OF UNSAFE BUILDING.
   (a)    If the person served with a notice or order to remove or repair an
unsafe building or structure should fail, within the time stated in such notice
or order, to comply with requirements thereof, the City Law Director shall be
advised of all facts in the case, and shall institute an appropriate action in
the courts to compel a compliance.
   (b)    If any person, when ordered by the Chief Building Official, or his
designee, to vacate an unsafe building or structure, fails to comply with such
order, the City Law Director shall be advised of all facts in the case and it
shall be the duty of the Police Department to aid the Chief Building Official,
or his designee, to vacate such building or structure.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.15 EMERGENCY WORK.
   (a)   In case there shall be, in the opinion of the Chief Building Official,
or his designee, actual and immediate danger of failure or collapse of a
building or structure or any part thereof so as to endanger life or property,
he shall cause the necessary work to be done to render such building or
structure or part thereof temporarily safe, whether the procedure described
elsewhere in this Building Code has been instituted or not.
   (b)   For the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this section, the
Chief Building Official may employ such supervisors, workmen, equipment and
materials as may be necessary.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.16 RECOVERY OF COSTS.
   When the Chief Building Official has found it necessary to cause emergency
work to be performed, as provided for, all costs thereby incurred in the
performance of such work and the furnishing of materials shall be promptly paid
by the owner of the premises on which such emergency work was performed. If the
owner, within thirty days after such emergency work is performed, fails,
neglects or refuses to pay such cost, the cost shall be paid from the proper
appropriated fund on the voucher of the Chief Building Official and such charge
will become a lien upon the property on which the work and cost were incurred.
The same shall then be certified to the Stark County Auditor who shall place
the charge upon the tax duplicate of the City with interest and penalties
allowed by law and collected as other normal taxes are collected.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.17 APPEAL OF CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL’S DECISION; EXCEPTION.
   (a)    The Chief Building Official shall determine all questions arising
under this Building Code.
   (b)   In case of dissatisfaction with any decision, except in respect to
insecure and unsafe buildings and premises requiring immediate action, the
question in dispute shall be referred to the Board of Building Appeals. (Ord.
165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.18 VALIDITY AND REPEAL.
   (a)    This Building Code shall be regarded as severable and any portion of
which is hereby declared as contrary to the Ohio statutes or contrary to the
Ohio Constitution, the same shall not affect the legality or the
constitutionality of the remainder of the Building Code.
   (b)   All ordinances or parts of ordinances inconsistent with the Building
Code are hereby repealed, however, any ordinance or part thereof the repeal of
which is contrary to the Ohio statutes is specifically reserved and such
ordinance or portion is not repealed.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1301.19 PERMIT FEE EXEMPTION FOR GOVERNMENT STRUCTURES.
   The Director of Public Safety is authorized to waive fees required pursuant
to
Part 13, Building Code, of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Canton for
the erection, construction, installation or repair of any structure located
within the City of Canton, or as applicable to the Plumbing Code only, to all
buildings connected to the City’s municipal water supply and sanitary sewer
systems beyond the City’s corporation line, which are owned by any political
subdivisions or governmental entity. Such waiver shall be made in the sole
discretion of the Director of Public Safety.
(Ord. 139-90. Passed 7-9-90.)
1301.20 ADMINISTRATIVE INSPECTION WARRANT.
   The Chief Building Official may apply to any court of record within his
jurisdiction for an administrative inspection warrant pursuant to Ohio R.C.
2933.21(F), under any of the following circumstances:
   (a)   If any inspection required pursuant to law is refused, hindered or
thwarted by the owner or the agent of the owner;
   (b)   If in the opinion of the Chief Building Official an inspection is
necessary to determine the existence of articulable physical conditions which
are or may become hazardous to the public health, safety or welfare of any
person or persons; or
   (c)   The Chief Building Official has reason to believe, based on an
occupant’s complaint, that hazardous or dangerous conditions exist or that
there are conditions existing which constitute a violation of the Building
Code.
      (Ord. 39-95. Passed 3-20-95.)
1301.21 INTERFERENCE WITH CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL’S DUTIES.
   No person shall interfere with the Chief Building Official or any officer or
employee of the Building Department, or any person authorized by such
department acting in the performance of their duties. (Ord. 39-95. Passed 3-20-
95.)
1301.99 PENALTY.
   Except as otherwise provided for, any person violating any provision of this
Part Thirteen - Building Code shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars
($100.00). Every day of violation shall be considered as a separate offense.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)

1313.08 et seq.
Plumbing permits - see BLDG.
1315.11 et seq.
Warm air heating permits - see BLDG.
1317.09 et seq.
 
1303.01 PERMIT REQUIRED PRIOR TO COMMENCEMENT OF WORK.
   (a)   The construction, erection or alteration of a building, or any
addition thereto, or the equipment and maintenance thereof, shall not commence
until proper permits are first obtained from the Chief Building Official or his
designee as provided by the City Building Code.
 
   (b)   When required by the Ohio Building Code and Residential Code of Ohio,
plans shall be prepared in conformity with the Ohio Administrative Code and
submitted to the Chief Building Official for approval prior to the issuance of
appropriate permits for any of the following:
      (1)   Before a building or addition to a building is constructed or
erected.
      (2)   Before a building is altered or relocated or building equipment is
installed therein.
      (3)   Before a change in use.
 
   (c)   All permits issued pursuant to this chapter shall expire twelve months
from the date of issuance.
(Ord. 125-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1303.02 PERMIT APPLICATIONS; PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS.
   (a)   Application for all permits shall be made in writing by the owner, or
his agent, upon forms furnished by the City. Such application shall be
accompanied by triplicate copies of the plans and specifications required by
the Ohio Building Code. The application shall include the following:
      (1)   Calculation of square footage per floor;
      (2)   Use Group as defined by the Ohio Building Code;
      (3)   Construction Classification as defined by the Ohio Building Code;
and
      (4)   Description of land, including lot number, address and name of
owner.
   (b)   All applications and plans and specifications shall be dated upon
receipt in the office of the Chief Building Official, and taken up in their
order as received, unless buildings or structures are of a complex character
which require prolonged examination and inspection.
   (c)   No person shall give or furnish false information in the application
for a permit.
(Ord. 125-93. Passed 6-29-93; Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
   (d)   All applications for permits shall include proof to the satisfaction
of the Chief Building Official of the following:
      (1)   For new construction and for renovations or repairs to existing
structures, the applicant will provide adequate arrangements for the orderly
collection and removal of construction debris and other solid waste generated
at the work site; and
      (2)   For new construction, the construction site will have adequate
facilities for temporary sanitation needs.
(Ord. 87-2002. Passed 5-13-02.)
1303.03 FEE FOR INSPECTION COMPLIANCE STATEMENT.
   A fee of three hundred dollars ($300.00) shall be charged by the City for
inspections under the Ohio Building Code requiring State or City licensing.
(Ord. 116-2009. Passed 7-20-09; Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1303.04 SCHEDULE OF FEES.
   (a)   Commercial Plan Examination Fees. All plans and specifications for
buildings covered by the Ohio Building Code shall be examined by the Chief
Building Official (Plans Examiner) under the provisions of the Ohio Building
Code and the City Building Code, where applicable. The fees for examination of
plans for remodeling, alteration, addition or new construction shall be as
follows:
                             Application Fee Plan Examination Fee (square feet)
General                      $ 100.00        $2.00/100
Plumbing                     100.00          2.00/100
HVAC                         100.00          2.00/100
Electrical                   100.00          2.00/100
Fire Alarm                   100.00          2.00/100
Automated Sprinkler and Fire 100.00          2.00/100
Suppression
Industrialized Units         100.00          2.00/100
Commercial Swimming Pool     100.00          2.00/100
   (b)   Dwelling Plans Examination. All new dwellings and additions require
plans examination. The fee for plans examinations made by the Chief Building
Official (Plans Examiner) for new or remodeled one-, two- or three-family
dwellings shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for each trade or seventy-five
dollars ($75.00) which shall include all trades.
 
   (c)   Schedule of Fees for Building Permits. Applications for all building
permits shall be accompanied by payment of the following fees:
 
(1)   Standard permit fee (includes only the final inspection)            $ 50.00
(2)   Any requested inspection                                            25.00
(3)   Reinspection fee for code violation                                 50.00
(4)   "No Show" reinspection fee                                          75.00
                                                                             $150.00
(5)   Inspections conducted before 8:00 a.m. and after 4:30 p.m. on legal per
holidays and Saturdays and Sundays                                           hour or
                                                                             portion
                                                                             thereof
      (6)   New residential, additions and alterations. All one-, two- and
three-family dwelling structures shall require fees in the amount of three
dollars ($3.00) per 100 square feet or fraction thereof of floor area, plus the
standard permit fee and such additional inspection fees as are required.
      (7)   New construction, additions and alterations under the Ohio Building
Code. New construction, additions and alterations regulated by the Ohio
Building Code (four-unit residential or greater, commercial or industrial)
shall require a permit fee in the amount of three dollars ($3.00) per 100
square feet or fraction thereof of floor area, plus the standard permit fee and
such additional inspection fees as are required.
      (8)   New accessory buildings, additions or structures. Private garages,
sheds, storage buildings, swimming pools (see additionally Chapter
1337 ), fences, roofs and decks shall require the standard permit fee and such
additional inspection fees as are required.
      (9)   Remodeling and alterations. Remodeling and alterations of any
existing structure, whether residential, commercial or industrial, shall be
based upon the contract value of the improvement, as set forth in the following
table, plus payment of the standard permit fee and such additional inspection
fees as are required.
 
Contract Value of Improvement Fee
Up to $1,000                  $ 10.00
$1,001 to $2,000              20.00
$2,001 to $3,000              30.00
$3,001 to $4,000              40.00
$4,001 to $5,000              50.00
From $5,001 and up, the fees are $5.00 per $1,000 or fraction thereof.
   (d)   Any contractor, to include home improvement contractors licensed
pursuant to Chapter
1311, who fails to obtain permits required by this chapter prior to the
beginning of work, except in those cases where emergency construction is
necessary, shall be required to obtain and pay for the permits which were
originally required and in addition thereto shall pay a penalty twice the
amount of the original permit fees.
 
   (e)   All fees shall be paid in full prior to issuance of the final approval
and/or the certificate of occupancy for the structure.
(Ord. 116-2009. Passed 7-20-09; Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1303.99 ENFORCEMENT AND PENALTY.
   See Section
1351.03(l) for the enforcement and penalty provisions for violations of this
chapter.
CHAPTER 1305
Board of Building Appeals
1305.01   Members; appointment, qualifications and vacancy.
1305.02   Organization and quorum.
1305.03   Rules and procedures.
1305.04   Powers and duties.
1305.05   Appeals of demolition order.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Appeal of Chief Building Official decision - see BLDG.
1301.17
Home improvement appeals - see BLDG.
1311.11
 
1305.01 MEMBERS; APPOINTMENT, QUALIFICATIONS AND VACANCY.
   (a)   A Board of Building Appeals is hereby created, which shall consist of
five persons. The members of the Board shall be appointed by the Mayor, subject
to approval of Council. The members shall be appointed for terms of three
years. Of the members, all of whom shall be conversant with light construction
industry, one shall be an Ohio registered design professional (architect or
engineer) who is a resident of Stark County or is employed or has their
principle place of business within Stark County, two shall be contractors
licensed by the City of Canton, and two shall be representatives of the public
at large. The contractors and two representatives of the public at large shall
be residents of the City or employed or have their principle place of business
within the City. No member shall act on any matter in which he or she has a
financial interest.
(Ord. 23-2024. Passed 2-12-24.)
   (b)   In the event of a vacancy on the Board, the Mayor shall, within thirty
days, appoint a new member who shall have the same qualifications as the member
whom he replaces and who shall serve the balance of the unexpired term of such
member. The members shall serve on the Board without compensation and until
successors have been appointed to succeed them.
(Ord. 126-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1305.02 ORGANIZATION AND QUORUM.
   (a)   The Board of Building Appeals shall organize by electing a chairman,
vice-chairman and a secretary, who shall serve for a period of one year. The
Chief Building Official or his designee, shall attend all meetings of the Board
and shall provide such information, services and assistance as it may require.
 
   (b)   A quorum shall consist of three members, and no official meeting shall
be held unless a quorum is present at roll call. The affirmative vote of the
majority of the members present at a meeting shall be necessary to pass any
resolution or make any decision.
(Ord. 126-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1305.03 RULES AND PROCEDURES.
   (a)   The Board of Building Appeals shall adopt rules and regulations of
procedure, which it may, from time to time, change at its discretion. However,
no rule or regulation shall be in conflict with any provision of Section
1305.02.
 
   (b)   Such rules and regulations shall fix the time and place of regular
meetings, and shall provide for special meetings, for appeal procedures and for
such other matters as are pertinent to the operation of the Board.
 
   (c)   Complete minutes shall be kept of every meeting, setting forth all
business transacted and decisions made. In case an appeal is adverse to the
appellant, the minutes shall contain the reason therefor. All minutes shall be
signed by the secretary. A copy of the minutes shall be sent to the Chief
Building Official or his designee, and to every appellant who has an interest
therein.
(Ord. 126-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1305.04 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   For the purpose of carrying out the intent of the City Building Code and
Residential Code of Ohio, the Board of Building Appeals shall have the
following powers and perform the following duties:
   (a)   Hear an appeal filed by any person, partnership, corporation or other
unincorporated association adversely affected by a decision of the Chief
Building Official or his designee in the enforcement of the City Building Code.
The Board shall have the power and authority to require by resolution that the
Chief Building Official or his designee modify, reverse or enforce his
decision. Appeals of demolition orders issued by the Chief Building Official
shall be subject to the provisions of Section
1305.05.
      (Ord. 219-2004. Passed 10-25-04.)
   (b)   Formulate and report to the Mayor, from time to time, recommendations
for amendments to the City Building Code as the public health, safety and
welfare may require.
   (c)   Determine by rule or regulation, on application to the Board, whether
any new type of material, method of construction or equipment is equal to that
required by the City Building Code, and to recommend same to Council the use of
new material incorporated in such Code. All questions involving the use of
material or methods of installation of material in the areas of plumbing,
electrical and HVAC shall be determined by the City Construction Board under
the provisions of Chapter
1309.
      (Ord. 126-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1305.05 APPEALS OF DEMOLITION ORDER.
   (a)   An owner of real property may appeal a demolition order of the Chief
Building Official to the Board of Building Appeals. Such appeal may challenge
the legal and/or factual basis for the demolition order and/or may request an
extension of time to perform necessary repairs as required by the report of the
Chief Building Official.
(Ord. 219-2004. Passed 10-25-04.)
 
   (b)   The Board may grant one extension of time to the next regularly
scheduled meeting, not to exceed 60 days, upon the request for extension of
time to complete necessary repairs and a showing of good cause. In addition
thereto, upon a showing of an extenuating circumstance or hardship, the Board
may grant one further extension not to exceed 60 days to residential and
industrial properties, and a second further extension to commercial properties
not to exceed a combined total of 180 days.
 
   (c)   Such granting of an extension of time to perform work required by
order of the Chief Building Official shall be conditioned upon the posting of a
cash performance bond by the applicant. The purpose of the bond shall be to
ensure that the work is performed in a timely manner and in compliance with the
Building Code. The bond shall be posted within ten (10) calendar days of the
granting of the extension. Failure to post bond shall result in the appeal
being denied and the demolition order being in full effect. The amount of the
bond shall be cash or in such other form approved by the Chief Building
Official and shall be in the following amounts:
 
Bond Schedule
Residential $5,000.00
Commercial  10,000.00
Industrial  10,000.00
(Ord. 77-2008. Passed 6-2-08.)
 
   (d)   If the appealing party fails to perform, the bond shall be forfeited
and applied as necessary to secure or raze the structure. If the repairs are
completed to the satisfaction of the Chief Building Official or his designee,
the bond or remaining balance thereof shall be returned to the appealing party.
(Ord. 219-2004. Passed 10-25-04.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1309
Canton Construction Board
1309.01   Members; appointment, qualifications and vacancy.
1309.02   Organization and quorum.
1309.03   Rules and procedures.
1309.04   Powers and duties.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Electrical - see BLDG. Ch.
1313
Plumbing - see BLDG. Ch.
1315 
HVAC - see BLDG. Ch.
1317
1309.01 MEMBERS; APPOINTMENT, QUALIFICATIONS AND VACANCY.
   (a)   The Mayor shall provide for the organization and maintenance of the
Canton Construction Board to include three advisory divisions which shall be
known as the Electrical, Plumbing and HVAC Sections. The Board shall consist of
the following nine members appointed by the Mayor and approved by Council in
the manner herein described.
      (1)   The Chief Building Official or his designee who shall serve on all
three aforementioned Sections.
      (2)   One Councilmember designated by the President of Council who shall
serve on all three aforementioned Sections.
      (3)   One member shall be appointed by the Mayor from the public at-
large, who is knowledgeable and conversant in the construction industry, and
shall serve on all three aforementioned Sections.
      (4)   One member shall be appointed by the Mayor who is an electrical
contractor licensed to work in the City to serve on the Electrical Section of
the Board. One member shall be appointed by the Mayor who is a journeyman
electrician licensed to work in the City to serve on the Electrical Section of
the Board.
      (5)   One member shall be appointed by the Mayor who is a plumbing
contractor licensed to work in the City to serve on the Plumbing Section of the
Board. One member shall be appointed by the Mayor who is a journeyman plumber
licensed to work in the City to serve on the Plumbing Section of the Board.
      (6)   Two members shall be appointed by the Mayor who are HVAC
contractors licensed to work in the City to serve on the HVAC Section of the
Board.
 
   (b)   The appointive members shall be appointed for terms of three years. Of
the seven members first appointed, two shall be appointed for a term of one
year, three for terms of two years and two for terms of three years.
Thereafter, terms of office are for three years, each term ending on the same
day of the same month of the year as did the term it succeeds. Members may be
reappointed.
 
   (c)   In the event of a vacancy on the Board, the Mayor shall, within thirty
days, appoint a new member who shall have the same qualifications as the member
whom he replaces and who shall serve the balance of the unexpired term of such
member.
 
   (d)   The members shall serve on the Board without compensation and until
successors have been appointed to succeed them. No member shall act on any
matter in which he has a financial interest.
 
   (e)   The Mayor may remove any member he has appointed to a Section or the
Board for malfeasance, misfeasance or nonfeasance.
(Ord. 127-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1309.02 ORGANIZATION AND QUORUM.
   (a)   The Canton Construction Board shall organize by electing a
chairperson, vice-chairperson and a secretary, who shall serve for a period of
one year.
 
   (b)   A quorum of the full Board shall consist of five members and no
official meeting shall be held unless a quorum is present. A quorum of a
Section shall consist of three members, and no action shall be taken by a
Section unless a quorum is present.
 
   (c)   The various sections of the Board shall meet at the direction of the
Board Chairperson to consider matters in the respective trade areas and make
recommendations to the full Board.
 
   (d)   The Chief Building Official or his designee shall serve as a member of
all three advisory Sections.
 
   (e)   In no event shall the Chief Building Official or his designee or the
Council designate serve as Chairperson of any Section or of the full Board.
(Ord. 127-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1309.03 RULES AND PROCEDURES.
   The Canton Construction Board shall adopt rules and regulations of procedure
which it may, from time to time, change at its discretion by a vote of at least
two-thirds approval. However, no rule or regulation shall be in conflict with
any provision of Section
1309.02 or any other statute, ordinance or law. Such rules and regulations
shall fix the time and place of regular meetings and shall provide for special
meetings, for appeal procedures and for such other matters as are pertinent to
the operation of the Board and its Sections. Complete minutes shall be kept of
every full Board meeting, setting forth all business transacted and decisions
made. In case an appeal is adverse to the appellant, the minutes shall contain
the reason therefor. All minutes shall be signed by the secretary. A copy of
the minutes shall be sent to the Chief Building Official, and to every
appellant who has an interest therein.
(Ord. 127-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
1309.04 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The Canton Construction Board shall meet upon the request of the Board
Chairperson and shall have such powers and perform such duties as are required
herein.
   (a)   The Board shall, upon application, consider appeals of the decision of
the Chief Building Official or his designee with regard to whether any
applicant for an electrical, plumbing or HVAC contractor's license has the
requisite experience to be licensed in the City.
   (b)   The Board, upon the request of the Chief Building Official or his
designee, shall have the authority to make recommendations to Council to accept
or reject the use of alternate materials, devices, methods of assemblage or
installations, fixtures or appurtenances relative to electric, plumbing and
HVAC, within the City that are not in conflict with any State law, rule,
regulation or requirement.
   (c)   The Board upon the request of the Chief Building Official or his
designee shall assist in the interpretation of the rules and regulations of the
applicable provisions of the City Building Code subject to subsection (f)
hereof.
   (d)   The Board shall hear and decide questions involving the suspension or
revocation of various trade contracting licenses or registrations issued by the
City, and also hear and decide questions involving revocation of permits issued
by the City.
   (e)   The affirmative vote of the majority of the members present at any
meeting shall be necessary to pass any resolution or make any decision or
recommendation. The Chief Building Official or his designee shall not
participate in any vote being considered by any Section on which the Chief
Building Official or his designee has previously made a decision. However, the
Chief Building Official or his designee shall be allowed to vote upon any such
matter when considered by the full Board.
   (f)   The Board shall have no authority to hear or decide questions
involving the interpretation or application of the Ohio Building Code or the
Residential Code of Ohio or any other area of responsibility of the City Board
of Building Appeals. Nothing in this chapter shall be construed so as to
diminish the duties and responsibilities of the Board of Building Appeals.
      (Ord. 127-93. Passed 6-29-93.)
