1313.10 PLANS EXAMINATION.
   (a)    All plans and specifications required to be submitted in triplicate
shall be examined by the Chief Building Official (Plans Examiner) or his
designee for acceptability under the provisions of this chapter and the
National Electric Code. Fees for processing and the inspection of plans and
specifications for buildings governed by the Ohio Building Code shall be as set
forth in Section
1303.04.
 
   (b)    Fees for processing and the inspection of plans and specifications
for commercial buildings shall be as set forth in Section
1303.04.
(Ord. 257-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
 
   (c)    Fees charged for plans examinations made by the Electrical Inspector
for new or remodeled one-, two- and three-family dwellings shall be as set
forth in Section
1303.04.
(Ord. 242-02. Passed 12-16-02.)
1313.11 RECORDS OF PERMITS AND INSPECTIONS.
   The Electrical Inspector shall keep complete records of all permits issued
and inspections made and other official work performed under the provisions of
this chapter.
(Ord. 257-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1313.12 INSPECTION PRIOR TO COVERING WORK; NOTICE AND INSPECTION CERTIFICATE.
   Upon completion of the wiring of any building, it shall be the duty of the
person, firm, corporation or other entity installing the same, to notify the
Electrical Inspector who shall inspect the installation within forty-eight
hours from the time such notice is given. If it is found to be in full
compliance with all laws relating thereof and this chapter and does not
constitute a hazard to life and property, the Electrical Inspector shall issue
to such person, firm, corporation or other entity, for delivery to the owner, a
certificate of inspection authorizing connection to such electrical service and
the turning on of the current. All wires which are to be hidden from view shall
be inspected before concealment and any person, firm, corporation or other
entity installing such wires, shall notify the Electrical Inspector and give
him twenty-four hours’ notice in which to make the required inspection before
such wires are concealed.
(Ord. 257-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1313.13 ENTRY FOR ELECTRICAL INSPECTION.
   The Chief Building Official, or his designee, is authorized to enter the
structure or premises at reasonable times to inspect or to perform the duties
imposed by this code, provided that credentials are presented to the occupant
and that entry is requested and obtained. Where permission to enter has not
been obtained, is denied, or the Chief Building Official, or his designee, has
probable cause to believe that there exists in a structure or upon a premises a
condition which is a serious hazard, the Chief Building Official, or his
designee, shall have recourse to the remedies provided by law to secure entry.
(Ord. 247-2010. Passed 12-27-10.)
1313.14 DUTIES OF ELECTRICAL INSPECTOR; PROHIBITION AGAINST PERFORMING WORK
WITHOUT LICENSE OR REGISTRATION.
   (a)    Electrical inspectors employed by the City shall hold a valid
certification from the State of Ohio Department of Commerce as required per the
Residential Code of Ohio and the Ohio Building Code.
   (b)   The duties of the Electrical Inspector shall be to enforce all of the
provisions of this chapter, the Ohio Building Code, Residential Code of Ohio
and the standards of any adopted or referenced codes.
   (c)    It shall be the duty and the responsibility of the Electrical
Inspector, and his duly appointed assistants, to monitor compliance with and to
enforce all of the provisions of this chapter. If the Electrical Inspector
reasonably determines that a person is performing work covered by this chapter
without first obtaining an appropriate license or registration, the Inspector
shall immediately notify such person of the apparent violation. The alleged
violator shall have five (5) work days to obtain the appropriate license or
registration. If such person does not obtain an appropriate license or
registration, the Inspector shall refer the apparent violation to the Canton
Construction Board for hearing pursuant to Chapter
1309. The Board shall issue a notice of a due process hearing to the alleged
violator. The alleged violator shall be given an opportunity to appear before
the Board and present whatever evidence he/she has in mitigation of the
charges. If the Board determines that the alleged violator was performing work
covered by this chapter without first obtaining an appropriate license or
registration, the Board shall issue an order prohibiting such person from
performing any work until an appropriate license or registration is obtained.
The remedies authorized in this section are in addition to any other remedies
provided in this chapter.
   (d)    The construction, erection, and alteration of a building, and any
addition thereto, and the equipment and maintenance thereof, shall conform to
required plans which have been approved by the Chief Building Official, except
for minor deviations which do not involve a violation of the rules of the
Board. In the absence of fraud or a serious safety or sanitation hazard, any
structure built in accordance with approved plans shall be conclusively
presumed to comply with Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 and the rules of the
Board.
   (e)    The Electrical Inspector shall not, during his employment with the
City as a certified Electrical Inspector, be employed or engaged, directly or
indirectly, in any manner, with any licensed contractor, or enter into any
contract for electrical work for others, or furnish materials, plans or
specifications for others engaged in electrical work in the City.
   (f)    The Electrical Inspector shall be under the direction and control of
the Chief Building Official or his designee.
(Ord. 247-2010. Passed 12-27-10.)
1313.15 WORK SUSPENSION ORDERS, ELECTRICAL.
   (a)    Whenever there is reasonable cause to believe that work on any
project that is subject to the provisions of this chapter, and for which a
permit has been issued under this chapter, is being performed or carried on by
persons who have not obtained appropriate licensing or registration under this
chapter, the Electrical Inspector shall notify the Chief Building Official and
the Canton Construction Board.
   (b)    Whenever the Chief Building Official finds any work regulated by this
code being performed in a manner contrary to the provisions of this code or in
a dangerous or unsafe manner, the Chief Building Official is authorized to
issue a stop work order whenever the Chief Building Official finds, after
inspection, that the site preparations or structure to be constructed, or in
the case of an industrialized unit, the installation of the unit, or that the
use of an appliance, materials, assemblage, or manufactured product does not
comply with the provisions of Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 or the rules
adopted pursuant thereto. The effect of such an order shall be limited to the
matter specified in the order.
(Ord. 247-2010. Passed 12-27-10.)
1313.16 COMPLIANCE, PROHIBITIONS, VIOLATIONS AND CIVIL PENALTIES.
   (a)    No person shall violate any provision of Chapter
1313, Electrical, or any order made pursuant to this chapter.
   (b)    Any person who has been found to be in violation of this chapter or
any order issued pursuant to Chapter
1313, may be assessed a civil penalty of not more than one thousand dollars
($1,000) for each violation.
   (c)    Any person who fails to correct a violation of this chapter during
the period set by the Chief Building Official and/or the Canton Construction
Board for a correction of that violation may be assessed a civil penalty of not
more than one thousand dollars ($1,000) for each day during which such failure
or violation continues.
   (d)    The Canton Construction Board shall give due consideration to the
following factors prior to imposing a civil penalty for a violation of this
chapter:
      (1)   The gravity, seriousness and surrounding circumstances of the
alleged violation.
      (2)   The apparent good faith of the person being charged with a
violation.
      (3)   The person's history of violations.
   (e)    Civil penalties imposed by this chapter shall be paid to the City of
Canton and shall be deposited into the City's General Revenue Fund. Civil
penalties imposed under this chapter may be recovered in a civil action brought
in the name of the City of Canton, the Canton Construction Board and the City's
Chief Building Official in any court of competent jurisdiction. In any such
civil action, the City of Canton, through its Law Department, shall also apply
to the court for an award of costs, reasonable expenses and attorney's fees.
The penalties imposed by this section are civil remedies and are in addition to
any criminal penalties that may be imposed and prosecuted under this chapter or
under applicable Ohio law.
   (f)    As used in this section, the term "person" includes an individual,
partnership, corporation, sole proprietorship or any other business entity.
   (g)    The term "violation", as used herein, shall not encompass work,
materials or procedures that are within the jurisdiction of the Ohio Board of
Building Standards or the Canton Board of Building Appeals.
(Ord. 247-2010. Passed 12-27-10.)
1313.17 INSTRUCTIONAL PROGRAM EXEMPTION.
   An electrical contractor who holds a valid license and is currently
registered with the City of Canton may perform or directly supervise the
performance of electrical installation, repair, alteration or addition in
connection with an instructional program for individuals who are not licensed
journeymen or registered apprentices, if all of the following requirements are
met:
   (a)   The instructional course or program is taught or sponsored by an
electrical contractor licensed by the State of Ohio and currently registered
with the City of Canton;
   (b)   Any and all permits otherwise required for the work to be done shall
be taken in the name of the sponsoring contractor;
   (c)   The contractor shall directly supervise the performance of the
instructional work;
   (d)   The work to be performed is done for the benefit of a recognized non-
profit or charitable entity or upon referral from a recognized non-profit or
charitable entity; and
   (e)   The contractor shall provide to the Chief Building Official the names
of the participants, the location where the work is to be performed and the
expected duration of such work on forms prescribed by the Chief Building
Official.
      (Ord. 257-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1313.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the first degree.
(Ord. 257-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)

1315.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)    "Plumbing" means the practice, materials and fixtures used in the
installation, maintenance, repairs, extension and alteration of all piping,
fixtures, appliances and appurtenances in connection with any of the following:
sanitary drainage or storm drainage facilities, the venting systems within or
adjacent to any building, structure or conveyance; also the practices and
materials used in the installation, maintenance, repairs, extension or
alteration of systems conveying storm water, liquid wastes, sewage or water
supply to, from or within any premises to their connections with points of
public disposal or other authorized terminals.
   (b)    "Plumbing contractor" means any person, firm, corporation or other
entity that holds a valid and unexpired plumbing contractor’s license pursuant
to Ohio R.C. Chapter 4740 and that engages in, or directly employs another
person(s) to engage in, or that supplies persons to any other person, firm,
corporation or other entity that will engage in, the installation, alteration,
repair of or addition to plumbing in any building or property connected to the
sewer and/or water services of the City under any contract, written or verbal,
expressed or implied, with the owner, lessee, contractor, or person in control
of such property or building.
   (c)    "Journeyman plumber" means any person who engages in the
installation, alteration, repair or addition of any plumbing while directly
employed or engaged by a plumbing contractor registered by the City; or who
performs such services for a plumbing contractor registered by the City
pursuant to a “leased employee” agreement between the plumbing contractor and
any other person, firm or entity; or who performs such services pursuant to any
contractual arrangement or agreement with the plumbing contractor whereby the
journeyman plumber functions as an independent contractor.
   (d)    "Plumbing Inspector" means the Plumbing Inspector and all Assistant
Plumbing Inspectors who have valid certifications from the State of Ohio. The
singular shall include the plural in all references to the Plumbing Inspector
in this chapter.
   (e)    "Plumbing apprentice” means any person who is the holder of, or who
is required to hold a plumbing apprentice registration issued pursuant to this
chapter. A plumbing apprentice shall be indentured in a bona-fide program of
training recognized by the Federal and State Bureaus of Apprenticeship and
Training for the plumbing and pipefitting industry, and be directly employed
and engaged by a plumbing contractor registered by the City, and provide
services to such plumbing contractor pursuant to a “leased employee” agreement
or arrangement between the plumbing contractor and any other person, firm,
corporation or other entity or pursuant to any other contractual arrangement or
agreement whereby the apprentice functions as an independent contractor. A
plumbing apprentice shall work under the direct supervision of a plumbing
contractor or journeyman plumber as defined by this chapter. For purposes of
this section, the phrase “under the direct supervision of” shall mean a ratio
of one plumbing contractor or one journeyman plumber to each apprentice with
each being engaged in work covered by this chapter.
   (f)   As used in this chapter, the terms of “employed by”, “employ”, “in the
employ of”, “directly employed”, “directly employed by” or “engaged” mean that
the person to whom these terms apply is on the payroll of, and under the direct
supervision and direction of, a person, firm, corporation or other entity that
engages in the installation, repair, alteration or addition to any plumbing or
is required to obtain a license or registration under this chapter. Any other
definition or interpretation of these terms is inapplicable under this chapter.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.02 APPLICABILITY.
   (a)    The provisions of this chapter shall apply to and govern plumbing as
defined herein.
    (b)    This chapter and the rules and regulations promulgated pursuant
thereto shall apply in all buildings connected to the City's municipal water
supply and sanitary sewer systems whether situated inside or beyond the City's
corporation line unless otherwise exempted or excepted.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.03 OHIO PLUMBING CODE.
   The City hereby adopts the current edition of the State of Ohio Plumbing
Code, as set forth in Chapter 4101:3 of the Ohio Administrative Code, and any
additions or amendments as may be hereinafter adopted and promulgated which
shall be applicable for both residential and commercial structures in the City,
with the following additional requirements or exceptions:
(Ord. 153-2003. Passed 7-14-03.)
   (a)    Minimum size water service piping from the curb box to the meter
horn, except for replacement, shall be one inch.
   (b)    A meter horn shall be installed for one-inch or smaller service
lines. The location of the meter shall be subject to the approval of the City
Water Department.
   (c)    A floor drain shall be installed at all wall hung urinals. One floor
drain may serve three urinals on a waterproof floor.
   (d)    No portion of the drainage system installed underground shall be less
than two inches in diameter. Underground floor drains shall be four inches.
   (e)    All gas piping shall conform to the gas utility's company standards.
   (f)    No used equipment shall be installed unless such equipment is first
approved by the Plumbing Inspector.
   (g)    Thermostat or pressure balance controlled mixing device for shower
compartments and shower-bath combinations, pursuant to Ohio Administrative Code
4101:2-51- 30, shall not be required in one-, two or three-family dwellings.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.04 EXEMPTIONS FROM APPLICABILITY OF CITY PLUMBING CODE.
   The following areas shall be exempt from the applicability of the
requirements of the City Plumbing Code:
   (a)    All construction work done on the repair, replacement or maintenance
of storm sewers.
   (b)    Water softening, conditioning and treatment appliances.
       (Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.05 REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person, firm, corporation or other entity, except as exempted in
this chapter, shall engage in the installation, alteration, repair or addition
of any plumbing to any building or property connected to the City’s water and/
or sewer system unless such person, firm, corporation or other entity has
obtained a registration from the City as required by this chapter. Any person,
firm, corporation or other entity that supplies journeyman plumbers or plumbing
apprentices to any other person, firm, corporation or other entity for purposes
of engaging in the installation, alteration, repair or addition to plumbing in
any building or property connected to the City’s water and/or sewer system
shall obtain a registration as a plumbing contractor as required by this
chapter. The holder of the registration referenced in this section shall be
deemed the authorized representative of such person, firm, corporation or other
entity and shall act as such representative in all matters pertaining to this
chapter.
   In addition to any other consequences of a civil, criminal or administrative
nature, whoever violates this section shall be required to pay to the City an
amount equal to three (3) times the amount required by the City for the
applicable registration or license.
   (b)   The plumbing contractor’s registration shall be issued only to an
individual and such registration shall not be transferable. A registered
contractor may not represent and may not apply for permits for more than one
person, firm, corporation, or other entity. No registration issued under the
authority of this chapter shall be transferable. If the person to whom the
registration was issued ceases to be an employee or member of any person, firm,
corporation or other entity engaged in the business of plumbing contracting,
the person, firm, corporation or other entity, shall be allowed 120 days for
the completion of unfinished contracts but shall not thereafter be permitted to
engage in the business of plumbing contracting until a new registration is
issued to another authorized representative. The penalty described in
subsection (a) hereof shall apply to and be collected from persons, firms,
corporations or other entities working in violation of this section regardless
of whether they are a contractor, journeyman, apprentice or other status.
(Ord. 242-02. Passed 12-16-02.)
   (c)   The person, firm, corporation or other entity employing the holder of
a plumbing contractor’s registration and the individual holding the plumbing
contractor’s registration shall be jointly and severally liable for all
violations under this chapter.
   (d)   Unless otherwise excepted by this chapter, it shall be unlawful for
any person to undertake or to perform the work of any plumbing contractor, as
defined by this chapter, or to represent or advertise, either publicly or
privately, as being ready, willing or able to contract or to undertake to
perform such work, or to supply journeyman plumbers or plumbing apprentices to
any other person, firm, corporation or other entity for purposes of installing,
altering, repairing or adding any plumbing in any building or property
connected to the City’s water and/or sewer system without first having obtained
an appropriate registration as required by this chapter.
   (e)   No plumbing contractor shall permit or allow any person to engage in
the installation, alteration, repair or addition of any plumbing to any
building or property connected to the City’s water and/or sewer system pursuant
to a permit granted to such plumbing contractor unless such persons are
licensed journeyman plumbers or registered plumbing apprentices, as defined by
this chapter, and are directly employed by a plumbing contractor properly
registered with the City of Canton.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.06 REQUIREMENTS FOR PLUMBING CONTRACTOR'S LICENSE.
   (a)   Qualifications. Any person, firm, corporation or other entity seeking
a plumbing contractor’s registration under this chapter shall comply with all
of the following:
      (1)   The applicant shall present to the Chief Building Official a valid
and unexpired plumbing contractor’s license issued pursuant to Ohio R.C.
Chapter 4740.
      (2)   The applicant shall provide appropriate documentation and proof
that the applicant has complied with all of the requirements of Ohio R.C.
Chapter 4740.
      (3)   The applicant shall complete a registration application form to the
satisfaction of the City’s Chief Building Official.
      (4)   The applicant shall provide proper and complete identification.
         (Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
      (5)   The applicant shall tender an application fee in the amount of
seventy-five dollars ($75.00).
(Ord. 242-02. Passed 12-16-02.)
      (6)   The applicant shall provide documentation and proof that the
applicant has obtained, and has in full force and effect, contractor’s
liability insurance as required by Ohio R.C. 4740.06(B)(4).
      (7)   The applicant shall provide documentation and proof that the
applicant is in full compliance with Ohio R.C. Chapter 4121 and Ohio R.C.
Chapter 4123.
      (8)   The applicant shall provide documentation and proof that the
applicant has registered with the Income Tax Department of the City of Canton.
   (b)   Bond. A plumbing contractor registered under this section shall file a
surety bond in the sum of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) with the Chief
Building Official. Such bond shall be approved by the City Law Director and
shall require the plumbing contractor to save and keep the City harmless from
all losses and damages that may arise from the negligence or failure of the
plumbing contractor or his employees and agents, to comply with the provisions
of this chapter. Such bond shall continue in full force and effect during each
period that the plumbing contractor has an active registration with the City.
(Ord. 253-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
   (c)   Registration Fee. A registration fee in the amount of one hundred
fifty dollars ($150.00) shall be tendered by the plumbing contractor upon the
issuance of a registration certificate. Registrations issued during the year
shall require the full year's registration fee. Such registration shall be
renewable annually on or before December 31 of each year.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
   (d)   Workers’ Compensation Certificate. An applicant for a plumbing
contractor’s registration shall submit a copy of his Workers’ Compensation
certificate prior to being eligible for a registration. (Ord. 258-2001. Passed
12-10-01.)
   (e)   Renewal. A registration shall be renewed annually upon the
presentation of a valid and unexpired plumbing contractor's issued pursuant to
Ohio R.C. Chapter 4740 and upon the payment of one hundred fifty dollars
($150.00) on or before December 31 of each year without the requirement of
reapplication. A seventy-five dollar ($75.00) late fee shall be assessed for
registration renewals after December 31.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
   (f)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association may
hold or renew a Plumbing Contractor Registration unless the Contractor is paid
in full or is current and not otherwise delinquent in the payment of City
income taxes, including any obligation to pay taxes withheld from employees
under Section
182.05 and any payment on net profits under Section
182.06.
      (1)   A certificate of compliance issued by the Treasurer or the Canton
Income Tax Department must be provided at the time of application for
registration or renewal.
      (2)   Falsification of any information related to or any violation of the
requirement to pay City income taxes set forth in subsection (f) shall
constitute cause for the rescission of the registration at the City’s
discretion.
      (3)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association
which has as one of its partners, shareholders or owners, a person who is a
twenty percent (20%) or greater equity owner in such partnership, corporation
or unincorporated association and who is delinquent in the payment of City
income taxes as set forth in subsection (f), may receive or renew a
registration with the City under Chapters
1311, 1312,
1313,
1315,
1317,
1319 or
1321.
      (4)   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold all City income taxes
due or payable under Chapter
182 of the Codified Ordinances for wages, salaries, fees, and commissions paid
to its employees and further agrees that any of its subcontractors shall be
required to agree to withhold any such City income taxes due for services
performed under this contract. In addition the licensed contractor agrees with
the City regarding the manner of withholding of City income taxes as provided
in Section 718.011(F) of the Ohio Revised Code.
         A.   Municipal income tax withholding provisions of Sections 718.011
(B)(1) and 718.011(D) of the Ohio Revised Code shall not apply to qualifying
wages paid to the licensed contractor’s or any of its subcontractor’s employees
for work done or services performed or rendered inside the City or on City
property.
         B.   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold income tax for the
City from employees’ qualifying wages earned inside the City or on City
property, beginning with the first day of work done or services performed or
rendered inside the City.
            (Ord. 252-2016. Passed 12-12-16.)
1315.07 HOME OWNER'S EXEMPTION.
   (a)    No provision of this chapter shall be interpreted to require that the
owner of a single-family dwelling, who personally performs work upon the
premises occupied or to be occupied by the owner thereof as such owner’s
established residence shall be licensed or registered. Such owner shall be
issued a permit for the work providing he satisfactorily qualifies through an
interview given by the Chief Building Official or his designee.
   (b)    All such work shall be done in conformity with the provisions of this
chapter, the City or State Building Codes and laws, and no work shall be done
unless all permits required by this chapter and the City Building Code are
obtained.
   (c)    A home owner shall furnish a signed, sworn or affirmed affidavit that
he is the owner and resident of such one-family dwelling and shall perform the
work himself and intends to reside at that location for at least one year or
more.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.08 EXCEPTIONS TO REQUIREMENTS OF PLUMBING CONTRACTOR REGISTRATION.
   A plumbing contractor's registration is not required for the replacement of
food grinders or disposals, laundry and dishwashing appliances, and water
softening, conditioning and treatment appliances, in less than four-unit
dwelling structures.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.09 LICENSING REQUIREMENTS FOR JOURNEYMAN PLUMBER.
   Any individual who performs plumbing work in the City as a journeyman
plumber shall comply with the requirements of this section:
   (a)   Examination. All individuals seeking a journeyman plumber’s license
from the City shall successfully pass an examination. This examination shall be
prescribed and administered by the Canton Construction Board. Such examinations
shall be conducted at least once every two months, provided there is an
applicant therefor. An applicant who fails the examination for a journeyman
plumber’s license on two occasions within the preceding twelve months shall be
prohibited from obtaining such a license, whether through further examinations
or through reciprocity, for a period of one year from the date of the last
examination. (Ord. 242-2007. Passed 12-17-07.)
   (b)   Qualifications. All individuals seeking a license as a journeyman
plumber shall provide proof to the satisfaction of the Chief Building Official
or his designee and at least one member of the Plumbing Section of the Canton
Construction Board that such applicant has worked as a plumber for a minimum of
four years. Evenly divided opinions shall be resolved by the entire Board. By
way of example and not limitation, this requirement may be satisfied by proof
of a combination of practical experience and technical training from a
plumber’s trade school approved by the U.S. Department of Labor, Bureau of
Apprenticeship and Training. An applicant may appeal an adverse decision under
this requirement to the entire Canton Construction Board.
   (c)   Acknowledgement. All individuals seeking a license as a journeyman
plumber shall acknowledge in writing receipt of the list of requirements
imposed by the City that are in addition to the requirements of the Ohio
Plumbing Code.
      (Ord. 81-2004. Passed 5-10-04.)
   (d)   Application. An application for a journeyman plumber’s license shall
be made in writing by the person applying for such license. Said application
shall be on forms prescribed by the Canton Construction Board.
      (Ord. 242-2007. Passed 12-17-07.)
   (e)   Application Fee. Applicants for a journeyman plumber’s license shall
pay a fee of thirty-five dollars ($35.00), which shall include fifteen dollars
($15.00) for a license fee and twenty dollars ($20.00) for the application fee.
   (f)   Proof of Exam. An applicant for a journeyman plumber’s license shall
present to the Chief Building Official or his designee proof that he has
successfully passed the examination referred to in subsection (a) hereof.
   (g)   Renewal. Licenses shall be renewed annually upon the payment of
fifteen dollars ($15.00) on or before February 28 of each year without the
requirement of reapplication. A twenty dollar ($20.00) late fee shall be
assessed for license renewals after February 28. (Ord. 81-2004. Passed 5-10-
04.)
   (h)   Reciprocity. In lieu of the requirement to successfully pass an
examination administered by the Canton Construction Board, an applicant for a
journeyman plumber’s license shall receive such license from the City of Canton
Building Department if all of the first three conditions, or the fourth
condition, are met:
      (1)   The applicant presents a valid and current journeyman license
issued by a political subdivision within Stark County, Ohio; and
      (2)   The license from the other subdivision must have been issued after
the applicant successfully passed an examination in such political subdivision
to obtain the license, provided however, that the Plumbing Section of the
Canton Construction Board must have determined that the qualifications and
examination of such other political subdivision are the same or the equivalent
of the qualifications and examination which would be required in the City of
Canton; and
      (3)   The applicant presenting the license from another political
subdivision must not have previously taken and failed the examination for a
journeyman plumber’s license administered by the City of Canton and/or Canton
Construction Board twice within the preceding twelve months; or
      (4)   The applicant presents a current, valid State of Ohio plumbing
contractor’s license obtained through an examination.
         (Ord. 242-2007. Passed 12-17-07.)
   (i)   Requirements. An application for registration as plumbing apprentice
shall be made in writing in the name of the person applying therefor on forms
provided by the Chief Building Official which have been approved by the Canton
Construction Board. The applicant also shall submit appropriate proof and
documentation that the applicant presently is engaged in learning the plumbing
and pipefitting trade by being indentured in a training program registered with
and approved by the U.S. Department of Labor, Bureau of Apprenticeship and
Training (Form ETA 671 or its replacement), and that the applicant is presently
learning and being instructed in the plumbing trade by working under the direct
supervision of a plumbing contractor or journeyman plumber as defined by this
chapter. The applicant may not establish his/her participation in such approved
training program by presenting documentation that the applicant has been issued
a registration and/or license by another political subdivision within the State
of Ohio or elsewhere. The applicant shall be required to pay a fee of twenty
dollars ($20.00), which shall include ten dollars ($10.00) for an application
fee and ten dollars ($10.00) for a registration fee in order to secure a
plumbing apprentice registration. Such registration shall be renewed annually
upon the payment of ten dollars ($10.00) on or before February 28 of each year
without the necessity of a formal reapplication. A ten dollar ($10.00) late fee
shall be assessed for plumbing apprentice registration renewals that occur
after February 28. (Ord. 81-2004. Passed 5-10-04.)
1315.10 SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION.
   (a)   Suspension or Revocation. Any license or registration issued under
this chapter may be suspended or revoked by written order of the Canton
Construction Board for any of the following:
      (1)   Any violation of the Ohio Revised Code or City ordinances relating
to plumbing work;
      (2)   For any failure to immediately, upon receiving notice from the
Plumbing Inspector, repair or correct any work previously done which may be
found in any respect to be defective or unlawful;
      (3)   If the license or registration was obtained by misrepresentation or
fraud; or
      (4)   If the business transactions of the contractor have been marked by
a practice of failure to satisfactorily perform its contracts.
   (b)   Records/Violations. The Plumbing Inspector shall keep a record showing
the date, name of licensee, location, and owner or person in control of
property where any work is performed contrary to City and/or state code
requirements or where any plumbing contractor has failed to obtain a permit as
required in this chapter. The Plumbing Inspector shall provide written notice
to the licensee of such defects and the licensee or person responsible for the
job shall
immediately correct such defects. If the licensee claims that the work or
material on the job is proper, he shall, within two business days after receipt
of notice from the Plumbing Inspector, appeal the determination of the Plumbing
Inspector to the Canton Construction Board. The Board shall order a
reinspection of the job by another pluming inspector and notify the licensee of
the results of the second inspection. If the permit holder is dissatisfied with
the report of the second inspector, the Board shall, upon written application
of the licensee made within three business days after the second notice, give
the licensee a hearing and the decision of the Board shall be final. The
licensee shall thereafter immediately correct the defects determined by the
Board to exist or be subject to suspension or revocation of his license
pursuant to subsection (a) hereof.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.11 PERMITS REQUIRED.
   (a)    Application for permits shall be made in writing on forms prescribed
by the City and shall state the name of the plumbing contractor or plumbing
contracting firm which is to make the plumbing installation; name and address
of the owner or owners of the building or property on which the work is to be
done; street and number of building or property on which the work is to be
done; and the date the work is likely to be commenced. Any contractor who fails
to obtain permits required by this chapter prior to the beginning of work,
except in those cases where the emergency installation of plumbing is
necessary, shall be required to obtain and pay for the permits which were
originally required and in addition thereto shall pay a penalty double the
amount of the original permit fees. No other plumbing contractor may use the
same permit.
   (b)    Substitution. The Plumbing Inspector may issue a second permit for a
plumbing installation (rough or finish) upon receipt from the property owner,
his authorized representative or a project general contractor, of a written
signed statement advising the City that the original permit holder has been
removed from the plumbing installation job and further identifying the
registered plumbing contractor who has been retained to complete the plumbing
installation. Issuance of a second permit shall be subject to all of the
requirements of this chapter, to include payment of permit fees, and shall be
further subject to the requirements that the second permit holder shall be
responsible for the completion of the plumbing installation, to include any
work initiated by the first permit holder, in accordance with the requirements
of this chapter.
   (c)    Expiration. A plumbing permit shall be valid for a period of twelve
months from date of issuance.
   (d)    Revocation. Any plumbing permit found by the Plumbing Inspector to
have been obtained by misrepresentation of facts or subterfuge shall be subject
to revocation by the Plumbing Inspector.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01; Ord. 116-2009. Passed 7-20-09.)

1315.13 EXCEPTION TO REQUIREMENT OF PLUMBING PERMITS.
   Notwithstanding the requirements set forth in Section
1315.11, no plumbing permit shall be required in the following instances:
   (a)   For the replacement of food grinders or disposals, laundry and
dishwashing appliances, and water softening, conditioning and treatment
appliances, in less than four-unit dwelling structures.
   (b)   For work done on building and storm sewers.
   (c)   For plumbing items identified in Chapter
1315.
      (Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
1315.14 PLANS EXAMINATION.
   (a)    Pursuant to the Ohio Building Code, the Chief Building Official or
his designee (Plans Examiner), shall require the applicant to furnish
triplicate copies of complete plans for the proposed construction,
installation, alteration or repair of any plumbing before a permit is issued.
   (b)    Fees for processing and the inspection of plans and specifications
for commercial buildings shall be as set forth in Section
1303.04.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
 
   (c)   Fees charged for plans examinations for new or remodeled one-, two- or
three- family dwellings shall be as set forth in Section
1303.04.
(Ord. 242-02. Passed 12-16-02.)
1315.15 INSPECTIONS.
   In any new building or addition, immediately upon completion of those
portions of the installation which are thereafter to be concealed or covered,
the plumbing contractor shall notify the Plumbing Inspector that such portions
of the installation are ready for inspection. No plumbing contractor or person
under his direct control shall drywall or cover up any plumbing work before
such work has been inspected and the building permit card stamped approved. The
Plumbing Inspector shall make inspection within two working days after notice.
The final inspection on new installations and repair, replacement or conversion
work shall be made upon completion of such work. (Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-
01.)
1315.16 ENTRY FOR PLUMBING INSPECTION.
   The Chief Building Official, or his designee, is authorized to enter the
structure or premises at reasonable times to inspect or to perform the duties
imposed by this code, provided that credentials are presented to the occupant
and that entry is requested and obtained. Where permission to enter has not
been obtained, is denied, or the Chief Building Official, or his designee, has
probable cause to believe that there exists in a structure or upon a premises a
condition which is a serious hazard, the Chief Building Official, or his
designee, shall have recourse to the remedies provided by law to secure entry.
(Ord. 247-2010. Passed 12-27-10.)
1315.17 DUTIES OF PLUMBING INSPECTOR; PROHIBITION AGAINST PERFORMING WORK
WITHOUT LICENSE OR REGISTRATION.
   (a)    Plumbing inspectors employed by the City shall hold a certificate of
competency issued by the Ohio Department of Commerce pursuant to Ohio R.C.
3703.01, the Ohio Building Code and the Residential Code of Ohio.
   (b)    The duties of the Plumbing Inspector shall be to enforce all of the
provisions of this chapter, the Ohio Building Code and the standards of any
adopted or referenced codes.
   (c)    It shall be the duty and the responsibility of the Plumbing
Inspector, and his duly appointed assistants, to monitor compliance with and to
enforce all of the provisions of this chapter. If the Plumbing Inspector
reasonably determines that a person is performing work covered by this chapter
without first obtaining an appropriate license or registration, the Inspector
shall immediately notify such person of the apparent violation. The alleged
violator shall have five (5) work days to obtain the appropriate license or
registration. If such person does not obtain an appropriate license or
registration, the Inspector shall refer the apparent violation to the Canton
Construction Board for hearing pursuant to Chapter
1309. The Board shall issue a notice of a due process hearing to the alleged
violator. The alleged violator shall be given an opportunity to appear before
the Board and present whatever evidence he/she has in mitigation of the
charges. If the Board determines that the alleged violator was performing work
covered by this chapter without first obtaining an appropriate license or
registration, the Board shall issue an order prohibiting such person from
performing any work until an appropriate license or registration is obtained.
The remedies authorized in this section are in addition to any other remedies
provided in this chapter.
   (d)    The construction, erection, and alteration of a building, and any
addition thereto, and the equipment and maintenance thereof, shall conform to
required plans which have been approved by the Chief Building Official, except
for minor deviations which do not involve a violation of the rules of the
Board. In the absence of fraud or a serious safety or sanitation hazard, any
structure built in accordance with approved plans shall be conclusively
presumed to comply with Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 and the rules of the
Board.
   (e)    The Plumbing Inspector shall not, during his employment with the City
as a certified Plumbing Inspector, be employed or engaged, directly or
indirectly, in any manner, with any registered contractor, or enter into any
contract for plumbing work for others, or furnish materials, plans or
specifications for others engaged in plumbing in the City, or any plumbing
installation connected to the City's water supply system.
   (f)    The Plumbing Inspector shall be under the direction and control of
the Chief Building Official or his designee.
(Ord. 247-2010. Passed 12-27-10.)
1315.18 WORK SUSPENSION ORDERS, PLUMBING.
   (a)    Whenever there is reasonable cause to believe that work on any
project that is subject to the provisions of this chapter, and for which a
permit has been issued under this chapter, is being performed or carried on by
persons who have not obtained appropriate licensing or registration under this
chapter, the Plumbing Inspector shall notify the Chief Building Official and
the Canton Construction Board.
   (b)    Whenever the Chief Building Official finds any work regulated by this
code being performed in a manner contrary to the provisions of this code or in
a dangerous or unsafe manner, the Chief Building Official is authorized to
issue a stop work order whenever the Chief Building Official finds, after
inspection, that the site preparations or structure to be constructed, or in
the case of an industrialized unit, the installation of the unit, or that the
use of an appliance, materials, assemblage, or manufactured product does not
comply with the provisions of Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 or the rules
adopted pursuant thereto. The effect of such an order shall be limited to the
matter specified in the order.
(Ord. 247-2010. Passed 12-27-10.)
1315.19 COMPLIANCE, PROHIBITIONS, VIOLATIONS AND CIVIL PENALTIES.
   (a)    No person shall violate any provision of Chapter
1315, Plumbing, or any order made pursuant to this chapter.
   (b)    Any person who has been found to be in violation of this chapter, or
any order issued pursuant to Chapter
1315, may be assessed a civil penalty of not more than one thousand dollars
($1,000.00) for each violation.
   (c)    Any person who fails to correct a violation of this chapter during
the period set by the Chief Building Official and/or the Canton Construction
Board for a correction of that violation may be assessed a civil penalty of not
more than one thousand dollars ($1,000.00) for each day during which such
failure or violation continues.
   (d)    The Canton Construction Board shall give due consideration to the
following factors prior to imposing a civil penalty for a violation of this
chapter:
      (1)   The gravity, seriousness and surrounding circumstances of the
alleged violation.
      (2)   The apparent good faith of the person being charged with a
violation.
      (3)   The person's history of violations.
   (e)    Civil penalties imposed by this chapter shall be paid to the City of
Canton and shall be deposited into the City's General Revenue Fund. Civil
penalties imposed under this chapter may be recovered in a civil action brought
in the name of the City of Canton, the Canton Construction Board and the City's
Chief Building Official in any court of competent jurisdiction. In any such
civil action, the City of Canton, through its Law Department, shall also apply
to the court for an award of costs, reasonable expenses and attorney's fees.
The penalties imposed by this section are civil remedies and are in addition to
any criminal penalties that may be imposed and prosecuted under this chapter or
under applicable Ohio law.
   (f)    As used in this section, the term "person" includes an individual,
partnership, corporation, sole proprietorship or any other business entity.
   (g)    The term "violation", as used herein, shall not encompass work,
materials or procedures that are within the jurisdiction of the Ohio Board of
Building Standards or the Canton Board of Building Appeals. (Ord. 247-2010.
Passed 12-27-10.)
1315.20 WATER SERVICE CONTRACTS.
   The Director of Public Service and/or the Superintendent of the Canton Water
Department is authorized to promulgate and execute a standard contractual
agreement with all users of City water, residents of the City or nonresident
users, setting forth regulations and conditions for the sale and use of City
water, to include, but not be limited to, the following requirements:
   (a)    That all plumbing installed for City water customers shall be done by
plumbing contractors licensed by the State of Ohio and duly registered with the
City of Canton, subject to the provisions of Section
1315.05.
   (b)    That all plumbing shall meet the standards of this chapter.
   (c)    That inspections shall be made in accordance with this chapter, and
that an appropriate fee schedule for inspections shall be met.
   (d)    That all necessary permits are obtained.
   (e)    That any and all other regulations and conditions deemed necessary by
the Director of Public Service or the Superintendent of the City Water
Department to protect the Canton water supply system shall be adhered to.
      (Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)
 
1315.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the first degree.
(Ord. 258-2001. Passed 12-10-01.)

1301.05
 
1317.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)    "Air conditioning" means the conditioning or treatment of air within
an enclosed space by a mechanical apparatus and, particularly, the lowering of
the temperature of air and control of the ventilation, filtration and humidity
of air primarily for environmental comfort. The refrigeration of air below 40
degrees Fahrenheit for commercial and industrial purposes is not included
within the meaning of "air conditioning" for purposes of this chapter.
   (b)    "Commercial structure" means any four-family unit or greater or any
structure used for private or public business as defined by the Ohio Building
Code.
    (c)    "Electric heat system" means any system of heating that uses
electric baseboard heaters, electric panel heaters or electric resistance heat
of any type, but does not include imbedded electric resistance heating.
   (d)    "Heating" means the conditioning or treatment of air within an
enclosed space by a mechanical apparatus for the warming of the temperature of
air primarily for environmental comfort and includes all ducted air heating,
electric heat, wet heat, air conditioning, when combined with a component of a
heating system, or other similar environmental apparatus.
   (e)    "HVAC/R" is an abbreviation for the words "heating, ventilating and
air conditioning/refrigeration" wherever used in this chapter.
   (f)    "HVAC/R contractor" means a person, individual or member of a
partnership, corporation or other incorporated association engaged in the
installation, alteration, addition to, repair or replacement to any heating,
ventilating and air conditioning/refrigeration system used or to be used in any
building within the City, under contract, written or verbal, expressed or
implied, with the owner, lessee, or contractor of any building and who holds a
valid unexpired license as an HVAC /Rcontractor issued pursuant to Ohio R.C.
Chapter 4740.
   (g)    "Residential structure" means any one-, two- or three-family dwelling
unit which is not constructed as an industrialized unit or units.
   (h)    "Ventilation" means the circulation of air within an enclosed space
by a mechanical apparatus primarily for environmental comfort.
   (i)    "Wet heat system" means any system of heating or cooling that
involves steam, hot water, chilled water or the transfer of heat by a
circulating fluid in a closed network of piping.
   (j)    "HVAC/R Inspector" means the Chief Building Official, HVAC Inspector
and all assistant HVAC/R Inspectors who have valid certification from the State
of Ohio. The singular shall include the plural in all references to the HVAC/
R Inspector in this chapter.
      (Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.02 APPLICABILITY.
   (a)    This chapter shall apply to the installation, alteration, addition
to, repair or replacement of all HVAC/R systems utilized in any residential or
commercial structure within the City, except as specifically excluded herein.
   (b)    In all HVAC/R systems, the air ducted distribution portion of the
system shall be installed and repaired only by a HVAC/R contractor licensed
pursuant to this chapter.
   (c)    This chapter shall apply to all other wet heat systems and nonducted,
nonelectric, heating units and shall require permits and inspections for
contractors who install or repair such systems as required by this chapter.
Either HVAC/R contractors registered pursuant to this chapter or plumbing
contractors registered pursuant to Chapter
1315 may install or repair these systems.
   (d)    In any wet heat system, HVAC/R contractors may furnish and install
all plumbing connections between the HVAC/R unit and the first connection from
the supply and return header on both the feed side of the system and the
distribution side of the system. This work shall conform to the requirements of
the Ohio Plumbing Code. From the first connection from the supply and return
header on both the feed side of the system and the distribution side of the
system and beyond, any water piping or other plumbing connections shall be
completed only by plumbing contractors licensed and registered pursuant to
Chapter
1315 and shall require permits and inspections as set forth in Chapter
1315.
   (e)    HVAC/R contractors may furnish and install all plumbing connections
between the HVAC/R unit to the first valve connection in any fossil fuel
system. This work shall conform to the requirements of the Ohio Plumbing Code.
From the first valve connection to the meter bar and beyond, any fossil fuel
piping shall be completed by a City registered plumbing contractor.
   (f)    In any installation, replacement or repair on any HVAC/R system, the
installer or repairer of such system, whether a HVAC/R contractor or a plumbing
contractor, may only make electrical connections between the end of the
existing feed and the item replaced or repaired. HVAC/R contractors may
additionally work on the low voltage control systems within HVAC/R systems
which they install or repair, subject to the restriction that they be limited
to working on not more than six low voltage thermostats which encompass, by way
of example, a thermostat controlling a damper or a duct heater or a variable
volume box or a solenoid per project. Registered HVAC/R contractors, or in the
case of wet heat systems, plumbing contractors, may not make direct connections
of the HVAC/R unit into the service or subpanel wherever located, nor shall
they be permitted to work on line voltage wiring, which connections and work
shall be performed by City licensed and registered electrical contractors.
   (g)    Nothing in this chapter shall be interpreted to prohibit electrical
contractors who are licensed and registered pursuant to Chapter
1313 from installing and repairing electric heating systems. Electrical
contractors shall not be required to be licensed and registered under this
chapter to perform installations or repair work on such systems, but shall be
required to obtain permits and inspections pursuant to Chapter
1313 for such work.
   (h)    This chapter shall not apply to the following:
      (1)    Portable, self-contained, noncommercial HVAC/R units which are not
attached to permanent wiring.
      (2)    The installation or repair of high pressure boilers in the City of
Canton.
         (Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.03 MECHANICAL CODES ADOPTION.
   (a)    The City approves and adopts the current edition of the Ohio Building
Code and Residential Code of Ohio, and any additions or amendments as may
hereinafter be adopted and promulgated, which shall be applicable to all HVAC/
R systems within all one-, two- and three-family dwelling structures in the
City.
   (b)   Low pressure boilers shall be installed according to manufacturers'
specifications and the Ohio Mechanical Code.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.04 REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   (a)    No person, corporation, firm or other entity shall engage in the
installation, repair, alteration or addition to any heating, ventilating and
air conditioning/refrigeration system used or to be used in any building within
the City without obtaining an appropriate registration as provided by this
chapter. The holder of such registration shall be deemed the authorized
representative of the person, firm, corporation or other entity in all matters
pertaining to this chapter. Such HVAC /R contractor's registration shall not be
transferable and the holder of an HVAC/R contractor's registration may not
represent and may not apply for permits for more than one person, firm,
corporation or other entity on any project. In addition to any other
consequence of a civil, criminal or administrative nature, whoever violates
this section shall be required to pay to the City an amount equal to three (3)
times the amount required by the City for the applicable registration or
license.
   (b)    The HVAC/R contractor's registration shall be issued only to an
individual and such registration shall not be transferable. A holder of a
registration may not represent and may not apply for permits for more than one
person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association. If the person
to whom the license was issued ceases to be an employee or member of any
person, corporation, firm or other entity engaged in the business of HVAC /
R contracting, the person, corporation, firm or other entity, shall be allowed
120 days for the completion of unfinished contracts but shall not thereafter be
permitted to engage in the business of HVAC/R contracting until a new
registration is issued to another authorized representative. The penalty
described in subsection (a) hereof shall apply to and be collected from
persons, firms, corporations or other entities working in violation of this
section regardless of whether they are a contractor or other status.
   (c)   The person, corporation, firm or other entity employing the holder of
a HVAC/R contractor's registration, as well as the individual holding such
registration, shall be jointly and severally liable for all violations under
this chapter. It shall be unlawful for any person to undertake or to perform
the work of a registered HVAC/R contractor, as defined by this chapter, or to
represent or advertise himself or itself, either publicly or privately, as
being ready, willing or able to contract or to undertake to perform such work
within the corporate limits of the City without first having obtained an
appropriate registration pursuant to this chapter.
   (d)   No holder of any HVAC/R contractor's registration, issued in
accordance with this chapter shall allow his or her name to be used by any
other person, firm, corporation or other entity for purposes of engaging in the
installation, repair, alteration or addition to any heating, ventilating and
air conditioning or refrigeration system within the City or for obtaining a
permit to do the same. No HVAC/R contractor shall permit or allow any person to
engage in the installation, alteration, repair or addition to any heating,
ventilating and air conditioning/refrigeration system within the City under any
permit granted to the HVAC/R contractor unless such person is in the direct
employ of the HVAC/R contractor or unless such person is in the direct employ
of another person, firm, entity or other corporation registered as an HVAC/
R contractor by the City.
   (e)   No holder of any HVAC/R contractor's registration issued pursuant to
this chapter shall utilize leased or rented employees, or engage independent
contractors to engage in the installation, alteration, repair or addition to
any heating, ventilating and air conditioning/refrigeration system within the
City, unless such leased or rented employees, or unless such independent
contractors are licensed and registered as journeyman electricians or
electrical apprentices under this chapter. Provided further that the person,
firm, corporation or other entity leasing or renting such employees or
providing independent contractors to such HVAC/R contractor shall be jointly
and severally liable with such registered HVAC/R contractor for all violations
of this chapter and for any personal injuries or property damage for which the
HVAC/R contractor is, or may become liable for, as a result of the work,
activity or actions of such leased or rented employees, or independent
contractors.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.05 EXEMPTIONS FROM APPLICABILITY OF LICENSING REQUIREMENTS.
   No registration is required to install wood stove or prefabricated
fireplaces, but a permit shall be obtained. Woodburning stoves and
prefabricated fireplaces shall be listed by Underwriters Laboratories or
another recognized testing laboratory and installed to the manufacturers'
specifications.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.06 REQUIREMENTS FOR HVAC/R CONTRACTOR'S REGISTRATION; FEE.
     (a)   Qualifications.  Any person, firm, corporation or other entity
seeking an HVAC/R contractor's registration under this chapter shall comply
with all of the following:
      (1)   The applicant shall present to the Chief Building Official a valid
and unexpired HVAC/R Contractor's License issued pursuant to Ohio R.C. Chapter
4740.
      (2)   The applicant shall provide appropriate documentation and proof
that the applicant has complied with all of the requirements of Ohio R.C.
Chapter 4740.
      (3)   The applicant shall complete a registration application form to the
satisfaction of the City's Chief Building Official.
      (4)   The applicant shall provide proper and complete identification.
      (5)   The applicant shall tender an application fee in the amount of
seventy-five dollars ($75.00).
      (6)   The applicant shall provide documentation and proof that the
applicant has obtained, and has in full force and effect, contractor's
liability insurance as required by Ohio R.C. 4740.06(B)(4).
An applicant may appeal an adverse decision under this requirement to the
Canton Construction Board.
      (7)   The applicant shall provide documentation and proof that the HVAC/
R contractor is in full compliance with Ohio R.C. Chapter 4121 and Ohio R.C.
Chapter 4123.
      (8)   The applicant shall provide documentation and proof that the HVAC/
R contractor has registered with the Income Tax Department of the City of
Canton.
   (b)   Bond. An HVAC/R contractor registered under this section shall file a
surety bond in the sum of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) with the Chief
Building Official. Such bond shall be approved by the City Law Director, and
shall require the HVAC/R contractor to save and keep the City harmless for all
the losses and damages that may arise from the negligence or failure of the
HVAC/R contractor, or his employees and agents to comply with the provisions of
this chapter. Such bond shall continue in full force and effect during each
period that the HVAC/R contractor has an active registration with the City.
   (c)   Registration Fee. A registration fee in the amount of one hundred
fifty dollars ($150.00) shall be tendered by the HVAC/R contractor upon the
issuance of a registration certificate. Registrations issued during the year
shall require the full year's registration fee. Such registration shall be
renewable annually on or before December 31 of each year.
   (d)   Workers' Compensation Certificate. An applicant for an HVAC/
R contractor's registration shall submit a copy of his Workers' Compensation
certificate prior to being eligible for a registration.
   (e)   Renewal. The registration required herein shall be renewed annually
upon the presentation of a valid and unexpired license issued by the Ohio
Construction Industry Examining Board and upon the payment of one hundred fifty
dollars ($150.00) on or before December 31 of each year without the requirement
of reapplication. A seventy-five dollar ($75.00) late fee shall be assessed for
renewals after December 31.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
   (f)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association may
hold or renew a HVAC/R Contractor Registration unless the Contractor is paid in
full or is current and not otherwise delinquent in the payment of City income
taxes, including any obligation to pay taxes withheld from employees under
Section
182.05 and any payment on net profits under Section
182.06.
      (1)   A certificate of compliance issued by the Treasurer or the Canton
Income Tax Department must be provided at the time of application for
registration or renewal.
      (2)   Falsification of any information related to or any violation of the
requirement to pay City income taxes set forth in subsection (f) shall
constitute cause for the rescission of the registration at the City’s
discretion.
      (3)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association
which has as one of its partners, shareholders or owners, a person who is a
twenty percent (20%) or greater equity owner in such partnership, corporation
or unincorporated association and who is delinquent in the payment of City
income taxes as set forth in subsection (f), may receive or renew a
registration with the City under Chapters
1311, 1312,
1313,
1315,
1317,
1319 or
1321.
      (4)   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold all City income taxes
due or payable under Chapter
182 of the Codified Ordinances for wages, salaries, fees and commissions paid
to its employees and further agrees that any of its subcontractors shall be
required to agree to withhold any such City income taxes due for services
performed under this contract. In addition the licensed contractor agrees with
the City regarding the manner of withholding of City income taxes as provided
in Section 718.011(F) of the Ohio Revised Code.
         A.   Municipal income tax withholding provisions of Section 718.011(B)
(1) and 718.011(D) of the Ohio Revised Code shall not apply to qualifying wages
paid to the licensed contractor’s or any of its subcontractor’s employees for
work done or services performed or rendered inside the City or on City
property.
         B.   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold income tax for the
City from employees’ qualifying wages earned inside the City or on City
property, beginning with the first day of work done or services performed or
rendered inside the City.
            (Ord. 252-2016. Passed 12-12-16.)
1317.07 HOME OWNER'S EXEMPTION.
   (a)    No provision of this chapter shall be interpreted to require that the
owner of a single-family dwelling who personally performs work upon the
premises occupied or to be occupied by the owner thereof as such owner's
established residence shall be licensed or registered. Such owner shall be
issued a permit for the work providing he satisfactorily qualifies through an
interview given by the Chief Building Official or his designee.
   (b)    All such work shall be done in conformity with the provisions of this
chapter, the City or State Building Codes and laws, and no work shall be done
unless all permits required by this chapter and the City Building Code are
obtained.
   (c)    A home owner shall furnish a signed, sworn or affirmed affidavit that
he is the owner and resident of such one-family dwelling and shall perform the
work himself and intends to reside at that location for at least one year or
more.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.08 SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION.
   (a)    Suspension or Revocation. Any license or registration issued under
this chapter may be suspended or revoked by written order of the Canton
Construction Board for any of the following:
      (1)    Any violation of the Ohio Revised Code or City ordinances relating
to HVAC/R work.
      (2)    For any failure to immediately, upon receiving notice from the
HVAC/R Inspector, repair or correct any work previously done which may be found
in any respect to be defective or unlawful.
      (3)    If the registration was obtained by misrepresentation or fraud.
      (4)    If the business transactions of the contractor have been marked by
a practice of failure to satisfactorily perform its contracts.
   (b)    Records/Violations. The HVAC/R Inspector shall keep a record showing
the date, name of registrant, location, and owner or person in control of
property, where any work is performed contrary to City and/or State code
requirements or where any HVAC/R contractor has failed to obtain a permit as
required in this chapter. The HVAC/R Inspector shall provide written notice to
the permit holder of such defects and the permit holder or person responsible
for the job shall immediately correct such defects. If the permit holder claims
that the work or material on the job is proper, he shall, within two business
days after receipt of notice from the HVAC/R Inspector, appeal the
determination of the HVAC/R Inspector to the Canton Construction Board. The
Board shall order a reinspection of the job by another HVAC/R Inspector and
notify the permit holder of the results of the second inspection. If the permit
holder is dissatisfied with the report of the second inspector, the Board
shall, upon written application of the registrant made within three business
days after the second notice, give the permit holder a hearing and the decision
of the Board shall be final. The permit holder shall thereafter immediately
correct the defects determined by the Board to exist or be subject to
suspension or revocation of his registration pursuant to subsection (a) hereof.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
 
1317.09 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   (a)    Application for permits shall be made in writing on forms prescribed
by the City and shall state the name of the HVAC/R contractor or HVAC/
R contracting firm which is to make the HVAC/R installation; name and address
of the owner or owners of the building or property on which the work is to be
done; street and number of building or property on which the work is to be
done; and the date the work is likely to be commenced. Any contractor who fails
to obtain permits required by this chapter prior to the beginning of work shall
be required to obtain and pay for the permits which were originally required,
and in addition thereto, shall pay a penalty double the amount of the original
permit fees. No other HVAC/R contractor may use the same permit.
   (b)    Substitution.  The HVAC/R Inspector may issue a second permit for an
installation (rough or finish) upon receipt from the property owner, his
authorized representative or a project general contractor, of a written signed
statement advising the City that the original permit holder has been removed
from the job and further identifying the licensed HVAC/R contractor who has
been retained to complete the installation. Issuance of a second permit shall
be subject to all of the requirements of this chapter, to include payment of
permit fees, and shall be further subject to the requirement that the second
permit holder shall be responsible for the completion of the HVAC/
R installation, to include any work initiated by the first permit holder, in
accordance with the requirements of this chapter.
   (c)    Expiration. A HVAC/R permit shall be valid for a period of twelve
months from the date of issuance.
   (d)    Revocation. Any HVAC/R permit found by the HVAC/R Inspector to have
been obtained by misrepresentation of facts or subterfuge shall be subject to
revocation by the HVAC/R Inspector. (Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)

   (a)    Permits shall be issued only to a licensed HVAC/R contractor,
