1317.11 PLANS EXAMINATION.
   (a)    Pursuant to the Ohio Building Code, the Chief Building Official or
his designee (Plans Examiner), shall require the applicant to furnish
triplicate copies of complete plans for the proposed construction,
installation, alteration or repair of any HVAC/R system before a permit is
issued.
   (b)    Fees for processing and the inspection of plans and specifications
for commercial buildings shall be as set forth in Section
1303.04.
 
   (c)   Fees charged for plans examinations for new or remodeled one-, two- or
three-family dwellings shall be as set forth in Section
1303.04.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.12 INSPECTIONS.
   In any new building or addition, immediately upon completion of those
portions of the installation which are thereafter to be concealed or covered,
the HVAC/R contractor shall notify the HVAC/R Inspector that such portions of
the installation are ready for inspection. No HVAC/R contractor or person under
his direct control shall drywall or cover up any HVAC/R work before such work
has been inspected and the building permit card stamped approved. The HVAC/
R Inspector shall make inspection within two working days after notice. The
final inspection on new installations and repair, replacement or conversion
work shall be made upon completion of such work.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.13 ENTRY FOR HVAC/R INSPECTION.
   The Chief Building Official, or his designee, is authorized to enter the
structure or premises at reasonable times to inspect or to perform the duties
imposed by this code, provided that credentials are presented to the occupant
and that entry is requested and obtained. Where permission to enter has not
been obtained, is denied, or the Chief Building Official, or his designee, has
probable cause to believe that there exists in a structure or upon a premises a
condition which is a serious hazard, the Chief Building Official, or his
designee, shall have recourse to the remedies provided by law to secure entry.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.14 DUTIES OF HVAC/R INSPECTOR; PROHIBITION AGAINST PERFORMING WORK WITHOUT
LICENSE OR REGISTRATION.
   (a)    HVAC/R inspectors employed by the City shall hold a valid
certification from the State of Ohio Department of Commerce as required per the
Residential Code of Ohio and the Ohio Building Code.
   (b)    The duties of the HVAC/R Inspector shall be to enforce all of the
provisions of this chapter, the Ohio Building Code and the standards of any
adopted or referenced codes.
   (c)    It shall be the duty and the responsibility of the HVAC/R Inspector,
and his duly appointed assistants, to monitor compliance with and to enforce
all of the provisions of this chapter. If the HVAC/R Inspector reasonably
determines that a person is performing work covered by this chapter without
first obtaining an appropriate license or registration, the Inspector shall
immediately notify such person of the apparent violation. The alleged violator
shall have five (5) work days to obtain the appropriate license or
registration. If such person does not obtain an appropriate license or
registration, the Inspector shall refer the apparent violation to the Canton
Construction Board for hearing pursuant to Chapter
1309. The Board shall issue a notice of a due process hearing to the alleged
violator. The alleged violator shall be given an opportunity to appear before
the Board and present whatever evidence he/she has in mitigation of the
charges. If the Board determines that the alleged violator was performing work
covered by this chapter without first obtaining an appropriate license or
registration, the Board shall issue an order prohibiting such person from
performing any work until an appropriate license or registration is obtained.
The remedies authorized in this section are in addition to any other remedies
provided in this chapter.
   (d)    The construction, erection, and alteration of a building, and any
addition thereto, and the equipment and maintenance thereof, shall conform to
required plans which have been approved by the Chief Building Official, except
for minor deviations which do not involve a violation of the rules of the
Board. In the absence of fraud or a serious safety or sanitation hazard, any
structure built in accordance with approved plans shall be conclusively
presumed to comply with Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 and the rules of the
Board.
   (e)    The HVAC/R Inspector shall not, during his employment with the City
as a certified HVAC/R Inspector, be employed or engaged, directly or
indirectly, in any manner, with any licensed contractor, or enter into any
contract for HVAC/R work for others, or furnish materials, plans or
specifications for others engaged in HVAC/R in the City of Canton.
   (f)   The HVAC/R Inspector shall be under the direction and control of the
Chief Building Official or his designee
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.15 WORK SUSPENSION ORDERS, HVAC/R.
   (a)    Whenever there is reasonable cause to believe that work on any
project that is subject to the provisions of this chapter, and for which a
permit has been issued under this chapter, is being performed or carried on by
persons who have not obtained appropriate licensing or registration under this
Chapter, the HVAC/R Inspector shall notify the Chief Building Official and the
Canton Construction Board.
   (b)   Whenever the Chief Building Official finds any work regulated by this
code being performed in a manner contrary to the provisions of this code or in
a dangerous or unsafe manner, the Chief Building Official is authorized to
issue a stop work order whenever the Chief Building Official finds, after
inspection, that the site preparations or structure to be constructed, or in
the case of an industrialized unit, the installation of the unit, or that the
use of an appliance, materials, assemblage, or manufactured product does not
comply with the provisions of Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 or the rules
adopted pursuant thereto. The effect of such an order shall be limited to the
matter specified in the order.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.16 COMPLIANCE, PROHIBITIONS, VIOLATIONS AND CIVIL PENALTIES.
   (a)    No person shall violate any provision of Chapter
1317, HVAC/R or any order made pursuant to this chapter.
   (b)    Any person who has been found to be in violation of Chapter
1317, HVAC/R, or any order issued pursuant to Chapter
1317, may be assessed a civil penalty of not more than one thousand dollars
($1,000.00) for each violation.
   (c)    Any person who fails to correct a violation of Chapter
1317, HVAC/R, during the period set by the Chief Building Official and/or the
Canton Construction Board for a correction of that violation may be assessed a
civil penalty of not more than one thousand dollars ($1,000.00) for each day
during which such failure or violation continues.
   (d)    The Canton Construction Board shall give due consideration to the
following factors prior to imposing a civil penalty for a violation of this
chapter:
      (1)   The gravity, seriousness and surrounding circumstances of the
alleged violation.
      (2)   The apparent good faith of the person being charged with a
violation.
      (3)   The person's history of violations.
   (e)    Civil penalties imposed by this chapter shall be paid to the City of
Canton and shall be deposited into the City's General Revenue Fund. Civil
penalties imposed under this chapter may be recovered in a civil action brought
in the name of the City of Canton, the Canton Construction Board and the City's
Chief Building Official in any court of competent jurisdiction. In any such
civil action, the City of Canton, through its Law Department, shall also apply
to the court for an award of costs, reasonable expenses and attorney's fees.
The penalties imposed by this section are civil remedies and are in addition to
any criminal penalties that may be imposed and prosecuted under this chapter or
under applicable Ohio law.
   (f)    As used in this Section, the term "person" includes an individual,
partnership, corporation, sole proprietorship or any other business entity.
   (g)    The term "violation", as used herein, shall not encompass work,
materials or procedures that are within the jurisdiction of the Ohio Board of
Building Standards or the Canton Board of Building Appeals.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.17 NOTICE TO OWNER OF CITY VERIFICATION OF DEFECTIVE HEATING EQUIPMENT.
   If an HVAC/R contractor finds that any heat exchanger or space heating
equipment is leaking products of combustion or that space heating equipment is
otherwise so defective as to require replacement, the contractor shall advise
the property owner or his agent and the HVAC/R Inspector, in writing, that the
leaking or defective condition may be verified upon request by the owner at no
charge by the HVAC/R Inspector. Forms for the purpose of this notification will
be furnished by the HVAC/R Inspector.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
1317.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the first degree.
(Ord. 132-2012. Passed 8-27-12.)
CHAPTER 1319
Demolition of Buildings
1319.01   Purpose.
1319.02   Enforcement.
1319.03   License and bond requirements.
1319.04   Demolition permit required.
1319.05   Inspection by Building Department.
1319.06   Demolition standards.
1319.07   Permit expiration and extension.
1319.08   Suspension or revocation of license.
1319.09   License and permit fees.
1319.10   Violation of permit conditions.
1319.99   Penalty.
 
1319.01 PURPOSE.
   The purpose of this chapter shall be to insure safe and controlled methods
of demolishing a structure within the City.
(Ord. 267-90. Passed 12-17-90.)
1319.02 ENFORCEMENT.
   The Building Department of the City is hereby authorized to enforce this
chapter.
(Ord. 204-94. Passed 8-22-94.)
1319.03 LICENSE AND BOND REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   No person, firm or corporation shall engage in the demolition of any
building or be employed or hired as a contractor or subcontractor to demolish
any building or part thereof without being licensed by the City to engage in
such work.
   (b)   No license shall be granted unless the applicant shall give a surety
bond to the City in the sum of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) on the condition
that the applicant shall pay any and all damages and injuries which may occur
to any private or public property; and that the applicant so licensed shall
save, indemnify and hold harmless the City against all liabilities, judgments,
costs and expenses which may in any way accrue against the City in consequence
of the granting of such license and permit, and shall in all things strictly
comply with the condition of his license and permit. The contractor shall file
and keep in force and effect a good and sufficient bond or continuance
certificate during such period of renewal of license.
   (c)   No license for a demolition contractor shall be granted until the
applicant shall provide evidence of liability insurance of not less than two
hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000) for personal injury liability and
fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) for property damage liability and, in addition
thereto, certification showing that all employees of the applicant are covered
by Ohio Workers’ Compensation or equivalent insurance. The contractor shall
further keep in force and effect the foregoing insurances during the period of
the license. (Ord. 267-90. Passed 12-17-90.)
   (d)   All demolition contractors, in addition to all other requirements of
this chapter, must at the time of initial application for a demolition
contractor’s license and at the time of every renewal of a demolition
contractor’s license, furnish a statement indicating the locations or places
where all demolition materials will be disposed of and documentary proof that
such disposal site or sites are approved by the appropriate state and/or local
authorities for the disposal of demolition materials. If the disposal location
or locations are in the Stark County District, the contractor must provide the
Building Department with a copy of their demolition materials disposal site or
transfer site permit from the Stark County Board of Health. No demolition
contractor’s license shall be issued or renewed until this requirement has been
satisfied. (Ord. 204-94. Passed 8-22-94.)
   (e)   A license shall be renewed annually upon proof that all requirements
contained in this section have been met and upon the payment of one hundred
fifty dollars ($150.00) on or before February 28 of each year without the
requirement of reapplication. A seventy-five dollar ($75.00) late fee shall be
assessed for licensing renewals after February 28.
(Ord. 242-02. Passed 12-16-02.)
   (f)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association may
hold or renew a Demolition Contractor Registration unless the Contractor is
paid in full or is current and not otherwise delinquent in the payment of City
income taxes, including any obligation to pay taxes withheld from employees
under Section
182.05 and any payment on net profits under Section
182.06.
      (1)   A certificate of compliance issued by the Treasurer or the Canton
Income Tax Department must be provided at the time of application for
registration or renewal.
      (2)   Falsification of any information related to or any violation of the
requirement to pay City income taxes set forth in subsection (f) shall
constitute cause for the rescission of the registration at the City’s
discretion.
      (3)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association
which has as one of its partners, shareholders or owners, a person who is a
twenty percent (20%) or greater equity owner in such partnership, corporation
or unincorporated association and who is delinquent in the payment of City
income taxes as set forth in subsection (f), may receive or renew a
registration with the City under Chapters
1311, 1312,
1313,
1315,
1317,
1319 or
1321.
      (4)   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold all City income taxes
due or payable under Chapter
182 of the Codified Ordinances for wages, salaries, fees and commissions paid
to its employees and further agrees that any of its subcontractors shall be
required to agree to withhold any such City income taxes due for services
performed under this contract. In addition the licensed contractor agrees with
the City regarding the manner of withholding of City income taxes as provided
in Section 718.011(F) of the Ohio Revised Code.
         A.   Municipal income tax withholding provisions of Sections 718.011
(B)(1) and 718.011(D) of the Ohio Revised Code shall not apply to qualifying
wages paid to the licensed contractor’s or any of its subcontractor’s employees
for work done or services performed or rendered inside the City or on City
property.
         B.   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold income tax for the
City from employees’ qualifying wages earned inside the City or on City
property, beginning with the first day of work done or services performed or
rendered inside the City.
            (Ord. 252-2016. Passed 12-12-16.)
1319.04 DEMOLITION PERMIT REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person, firm or corporation shall commence to demolish a building,
or part thereof, without first having obtained a permit from the Building
Department of the City of Canton.
   (b)   A homeowner may obtain a permit to demolish his own residential
accessory structures as defined in Section
1123.02 of the Planning and Zoning Code if the following conditions are met:
      (1)   The building does not exceed 720 square feet in size and is limited
to a one story structure.
      (2)   A written explanation describing the proposed work, and other
additional information as deemed necessary by the Building Department is
presented.
      (3)   The applicant signs an agreement stating all standards as set forth
in Section
1319.06 shall be met.
(Ord. 76-2001. Passed 4-30-01.)
   (c)   Any person, firm or corporation hired as a contractor or subcontractor
may obtain a permit to demolish a building or part thereof, if the following
conditions are met:
      (1)   All licensing requirements applicable under Section
1319.03 have been satisfied.
      (2)   A written explanation describing the proposed work, and other
additional information as deemed necessary by the Building Department is
presented.
      (3)   The applicant signs an agreement stating that all standards shall
be complied with as set forth in Section
1319.06.
      (4)   If deemed necessary by the Building Department, a pre-job
conference may be required. The Building Department shall determine the parties
who shall participate in such conference. Such parties may include, but are not
limited to, the applicant contractor, subcontractor, Police Department, Water,
Sewer and Engineering Departments of the City of Canton and utility companies.
         (Ord. 204-94. Passed 8-22-94.)
1319.05 INSPECTION BY BUILDING DEPARTMENT.
   The Building Department shall act upon applications in the order they are
received and without unnecessary delay. The Building Department shall be given
not less than forty-eight hours after the filing of an application for a permit
to demolish a building excluding Saturdays, Sundays and holidays, to inspect
such buildings and structures; and if it is found that the work can be executed
safely in the manner proposed, a permit shall be issued therefor.
(Ord. 204-94. Passed 8-22-94.)
1319.06 DEMOLITION STANDARDS.
   (a)   Any person, firm or corporation demolishing any building or part
thereof shall adhere to the following standards:
      (1)   All utility services shall be disconnected and equipment removed by
the utility companies. (Contractor to notify utility companies)
      (2)   All concrete basement floors shall be broken up for proper
drainage.
      (3)   All basement walls shall be reduced to two feet below existing
ground level.
      (4)   All sanitary and storm sewers shall be plugged at the outlet with
concrete.
      (5)   A basement cavity may be filled with noncombustible material to a
level two feet below existing ground level, as noted in subsection (a)(3)
hereof. Such noncombustible material shall not exceed an individual dimension
larger than a standard cement block.
      (6)   From two feet below existing ground level to existing ground level,
the basement cavity shall be filled with clean fill material and crowned to
provide for proper drainage after settlement.
      (7)   All rubbish, debris, lumber, glass or other materials from a razed
or demolished building shall be removed upon completion of demolition.
      (8)   Four inches of top soil shall be evenly spread over entire site and
graded to conform to adjacent properties.
      (9)   Apply seed mixture of 50% rye/50% bluegrass at a rate of 5 pounds
per 1,000 square feet. Rake to incorporate seed into soil.
      (10)   Any person demolishing a building or part thereof shall erect
barricades as specified by the Code Enforcement Department and shall provide
lights at the barricades between sunset and sunrise.
      (11)   Any person, firm or corporation demolishing any building or part
thereof shall provide to the Building Department, prior to the issuance of a
demolition permit, a certificate issued by a pest control operator certifying
that the property to be demolished is free and clear of food products pests
and/or rodent infestation; and if food products pests and/or rodent infestation
is found to be on the premises, the property shall be exterminated prior to
demolition.
      (12)   Any person, firm or corporation demolishing any building or part
thereof shall provide to the Building Department, prior to the issuance of a
demolition permit, a certificate or other documentary proof establishing that
the site at which the demolition materials are to be disposed of has been
properly certified as an approved materials disposal site or transfer site
approved by the applicable state and/or local site approval authorities. If the
disposal location is in the Stark County District, the contractor must provide
the Building Department with a copy of their demolition materials disposal site
or transfer site permit issued by the Stark County Board of Health.
      (13)   If any building or part thereof which is being razed or demolished
contains asbestos in quantities or under circumstances subjecting such asbestos
to federal and/or state asbestos removal regulations, the removal of such
asbestos shall be performed only by a person, firm or corporation certified by
the applicable federal and/or state approval authorities for such removal and
shall be performed in accordance with the methods and procedures required by
applicable federal and/or state statutes and regulations. If there is any
question or uncertainty regarding the existence of asbestos subject to federal
or state asbestos removal regulations, no permit shall be issued and no work
shall be commenced until a determination of the need for special asbestos
removal procedures has been determined by the Building Department and/or City
or County Health Department.
   (b)   The Director of Public Safety, through the Building Department or such
other department designated by the Safety Director, shall have the authority to
implement any and all such requirements as may be necessary to effect the
complete, safe and sanitary demolition of all properties, and to include the
reclamation of the property following demolition.
(Ord. 204-94. Passed 8-22-94.)
1319.07 PERMIT EXPIRATION AND EXTENSION.
   Any permit issued under this chapter by the Chief Building Official of the
City of Canton shall be valid for a period of thirty consecutive days
thereafter. For good cause shown, the Code Enforcement Department may extend
the effective period of such permit for no more than thirty additional days;
provided, however, that only one such extension shall be granted. The
commencement or continuation of the demolition of a building beyond the
permit’s effective time limit shall constitute a violation of this chapter, and
each day such violation occurs shall constitute a separate offense, punishable
in accordance with Section
1319.99.
(Ord. 267-90. Passed 12-17-90.)
1319.08 SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   Any license or permit issued under this chapter may be suspended or revoked
by order of the Chief Building Official for any violation of the City Building
Code, BOCA, the Ohio Fire Code or this chapter, or for any failure to
immediately, upon receiving notice from the Code Enforcement Department, repair
or correct any work previously done which may be found in any respect to be
defective or unlawful, or upon the existence of evidence reasonably tending to
indicate that the licensee is unqualified to safely perform demolition work.
(Ord. 267-90. Passed 12-17-90.)
1319.09 LICENSE AND PERMIT FEES.
   (a)    The fees for licenses and permits to demolish a building or structure
or any part thereof are as follows:
 
(1)    License fee and renewal                                           $150.00
(2)    Permit for demolition of a garage or other outbuilding (accessory 35.00
building having area of not more than 720 sq. ft.)
(3)    Permit for demolition of a single dwelling,    duplex or triple75.00
(4)    Permit for demolition of a four-unit    or greater residential 150.00
structure and any commercial or industrial structure
         (Ord. 242-02. Passed 12-16-02; Ord. 116-2009. Passed 7-20-09.)
   (b)    The foregoing permit fees shall be paid to the Code Enforcement
Department prior to the beginning of any demolition work. Any person, firm or
corporation who fails to obtain permits required by this section prior to the
beginning of work shall be required to obtain and pay for the permits which
were originally required and, in addition thereto, shall also pay a penalty
twice the amount of the original permit fees.
(Ord. 267-90. Passed 12-17-90.)
1319.10 VIOLATION OF PERMIT CONDITIONS.
   The owner and/or contractor or any person demolishing buildings shall be in
violation of this chapter if any of the permit conditions agreed to are
violated.
(Ord. 267-90. Passed 12-17-90.)
1319.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the requirements or provisions of this chapter shall
be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor and shall be punished according to the
penalties generally provided for such classification of offense in Section
501.99 of the Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 267-90. Passed 12-17-90.)

1313
 
1321.01 PURPOSE.
   The purpose of this chapter is to improve and ensure the reliability, safety
and quality of workmanship with respect to the installation, alteration or
replacement of low voltage telecommunications wiring and related system
conductors, devices and apparatus in the City of Canton, by the establishment
of requirements for the licensing of telecommunications contractors and for
permits and inspections of work performed.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.02 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)   "Telecommunications wiring and installation work" means the
installation, alteration or replacement of low voltage wiring and cables and
related conductors, devices and apparatus for operating equipment used for the
transmission of signals and/or information including, but not limited to,
telephones, telegraph, cable television, satellite television, computers,
telecopiers, burglar and security alarms systems and monitoring systems, and
other similar telecommunications equipment.
   (b)   "Telecommunications contractor" means any person, partnership,
corporation or other business entity which performs the installation,
alteration, repair or replacement of low voltage telecommunications wiring work
as defined in this chapter under contract with the owners, lessees, or persons
otherwise in control of any building premises within the City of Canton.
   (c)   "Residential structure" means any single-family, two-family or three-
family dwelling house.
   (d)   "Commercial structure" means any dwelling house containing four or
more family units and also any other structure used for any private or public
business purposes.
   (e)   "Low voltage wiring" means and refers to wiring and cable circuits
having limited capacity to conduct electric current and falling within the
parameters for voltage and amperage specified for Class II and Class III
circuits as set forth and defined in Article 725-31 of the National Electric
Code and the tables referred to and incorporated therein.
      (Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.03 TELECOMMUNICATION CONTRACTOR'S LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person, firm, corporation or other business entity shall engage in the
business of contracting for the installation, alteration or repair or
replacement of low voltage telecommunications wiring, devices and/or apparatus
in the City of Canton without being licensed as provided in this chapter,
unless specifically exempted from the application of this chapter under the
provisions of Section
1321.04.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.04 EXEMPTIONS AND EXCLUSIONS.
   The licensing and permit requirements of this chapter shall not be
applicable to the following entities and classifications of work, namely:
   (a)   Industrial manufacturers or hospitals performing the installation,
alteration, repair or replacement of telecommunications wiring and related
devices and apparatus within the confines of their own plant facilities and
with their own employees or having such work performed by licensed City
telecommunications contractors or subcontractors.
   (b)   Telephone utility companies and other telecommunications utility
companies operating under regulation and/or franchise of the State of Ohio in
the installation, maintenance, alteration, removal or repair of their wiring,
cables, conductors, apparatus or equipment used in connection with the
operation of their businesses.
   (c)   Electric power utility companies operating under regulation and/or
franchise of the State of Ohio in the installation, maintenance, alteration,
removal or repair of their wiring, cables, conductors, apparatus or equipment
used in connection with the operation of their businesses.
   (d)   Persons, firms or corporations engaged in the installation of fire
alarm systems and having been certified for such work by the State Fire Marshal
or his designated agents, with respect to work which is subject to permit and
inspection under Article 10 of the Ohio Building Code.
   (e)   The installation, alteration, repair or replacement of community
antenna television system cable and wiring by cable television companies having
franchises to operate in the City of Canton with respect to the provision of
cable service connections to residential premises or to commercial structures
where the connections are to fewer than four television monitors or terminals
within the building and/or where the cable service to television terminals or
monitors are not made through a central station or amplifier.
   (f)   For the purposes of this chapter, the telecommunications wiring work
shall be deemed and considered to be a subclassification and limited specialty
in the general field of electrical wiring and within the scope and purview of
electrical work which may be performed by electrical contractors under Chapter
1313 of the Canton Codified Ordinances. Accordingly, electrical contractors
licensed pursuant to the provisions of Chapter
1313 of the Canton Codified Ordinances shall not be required to obtain a
telecommunications contractor's license to perform any of the
telecommunications work covered hereunder. Provided, however, that electrical
contractors shall be required to obtain permits and inspections pursuant to
this chapter for any such work.
      (Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.05 HOMEOWNERS EXEMPTION.
   (a)   No provision of this chapter shall be interpreted to require that the
bona fide owner and occupant of a single-family dwelling shall be required to
be licensed when such person personally performs work upon the premises
occupied or to be occupied by the owner thereof as such owner's established
residence. Provided that all such work shall be done in conformity with the
provisions of this chapter, and the methods and materials as set forth in the
Ohio Building Code and/or the National Electric Code which have been
incorporated in this chapter; and no work shall be done unless all permits
required by this chapter are first obtained.
 
   (b)   A homeowner shall furnish a signed, sworn or affirmed affidavit that
he is the owner and resident of such one-family dwelling and shall perform the
work himself; and further stating that he intends to reside at that location
for at least one year.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.06 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
   (a)   The application for a telecommunications contractor's license shall be
made in writing in the name of the person, firm or corporation applying
therefor on forms prescribed by the City. If such application is made by a
partnership, it shall be signed by one of the partners; and if made by a
corporation, it shall be signed by a duly authorized officer of the
corporation.
 
   (b)   Each applicant for a telecommunications contractor's license shall be
required to meet the examination and qualification requirements and pass the
examination for telecommunications contractor as set forth in Section
1321.08, prior to being licensed.
 
   (c)   An applicant for a telecommunications contractor's license shall
further file with such application a surety bond in the sum of not less than
five thousand dollars ($5,000) for the approval of the City Safety Director;
the form of which shall be approved by the Law Director and conditioned that
the telecommunications contractor shall save and keep the City harmless from
all loss and damage that may arise from negligence or failure to comply with
the provisions of this chapter by the licensed telecommunications contractor or
his agents or employees. A licensed telecommunications contractor shall file
and keep in force and effect a good and sufficient bond or continuation
certificate with respect to such bond during each period of renewal of a
license.
 
   (d)   Applicants for a telecommunications contractor's license shall pay a
fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) to the City for the examination as set forth in
Section
1321.08(b) upon notification by the telecommunications examining board.
 
   (e)   The license fee for the issuance of a telecommunications contractor's
license shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00) payable upon the issuance of
such license and renewable annually thereafter. Licenses shall expire on
February 28 of each and every year.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
   (f)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association may
hold or renew a Telecommunications Contractor Registration unless the
Contractor is paid in full or is current and not otherwise delinquent in the
payment of City income taxes, including any obligation to pay taxes withheld
from employees under Section
182.05 and any payment on net profits under Section
182.06.
      (1)   A certificate of compliance issued by the Treasurer or the Canton
Income Tax Department must be provided at the time of application for
registration or renewal.
      (2)   Falsification of any information related to or any violation of the
requirement to pay City income taxes set forth in subsection (f) shall
constitute cause for the rescission of the registration at the City’s
discretion.
      (3)   No person, partnership, corporation or unincorporated association
which has as one of its partners, shareholders or owners, a person who is a
twenty percent (20%0 or greater equity owner in such partnership, corporation
or unincorporated association and who is delinquent in the payment of City
income taxes as set forth in subsection (f), may receive or renew a
registration with the City under Chapters
1311, 1312,
1313,
1315,
1317,
1319 or
1321.
      (4)   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold all City income taxes
due or payable under Chapter
182 of the Codified Ordinances for wages, salaries, fees and commissions paid
to its employees and further agrees that any of its subcontractors shall be
required to agree to withhold any such City income taxes due for services
performed under this contract. In addition the licensed contractor agrees with
the City regarding the manner of withholding of City income taxes as provided
in Section 718.011(F) of the Ohio Revised Code.
         A.   Municipal income tax withholding provisions of Sections 718.011
(B)(1) and 718.011(D) of the Ohio Revised Code shall not apply to qualifying
wages paid to the licensed contractor’s or any of its subcontractor’s employees
for work done or services performed or rendered inside the City or on City
property.
         B.   The licensed contractor agrees to withhold income tax for the
City from employees’ qualifying wages earned inside the City or on City
property, beginning with the first day of work done or services performed or
rendered inside the City.
(Ord. 252-2016. Passed 12-12-16.)
1321.07 BOARD OF TELECOMMUNICATIONS EXAMINERS.
   (a)   There shall be a Board of Telecommunications Examiners which shall
consist of two electrical contractors doing business in the City of Canton, two
telecommunications contractors doing business in the City of Canton, and one
electrical engineer, all of whom shall be appointed by the Mayor with the
approval of the City Council. In addition to the foregoing appointed members,
the Chief Electrical Inspector of the City of Canton and the Chief Building
Official of the City of Canton shall be permanent members of the Examining
Board. Initial appointments of the five members appointed by the Mayor shall be
for terms of one, two, three, four and five years. Upon the expiration of such
original terms and thereafter, the Mayor shall appoint, with the approval of
Council, successor members for terms of three years each.
 
   (b)   The Examining Board shall meet, organize and select a chairman within
thirty days after January 1 of each year. The Electrical Inspector shall serve
as Secretary of the Board.
 
   (c)   The presence of no less than five members shall constitute a quorum
for the transaction of business of the Board. The Board's decisions shall be
concurred in by at least three members of those present for any meeting.
 
   (d)   The Board shall make such rules and prescribe such procedures and
adopt such examining formats as may be necessary for the conduct of its
operations in conformity with this chapter. (Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.08 DUTIES OF EXAMINING BOARD; TELECOMMUNICATION EXAMINATIONS.
   (a)   The Board of Telecommunications Examiners shall prepare the
examinations and examine all applicants for telecommunications contractor's
licenses under this chapter as necessary to determine the qualifications of all
applicants.
 
   (b)   Every applicant for a telecommunications contractor's license shall
file an application for the license, together with payment of the examination
fee provided at Section
1321.06(d), at least thirty days prior to any scheduled examination date. The
examination of applicants for telecommunications contractor's license shall be
conducted at least once every three months in the second week of March, June,
September and December, at such times and places as designated by the City. The
examination shall consist solely of written multiple choice questions
pertaining to the approved materials, methods and standards for the
installation, alteration and replacement of communications wiring and other
signal wiring including telephone and telegraph systems, computer systems,
cable and satellite television systems; burglar alarm, security and electronic
monitoring systems, and other similar systems, as set forth and contained in
the applicable Articles of the National Electric Code and which have been
incorporated by reference in this chapter. The examination shall be given by
and graded under the supervision of the City Civil Service Administrator; a
passing grade on the examination shall require a score of at least seventy-five
percent (75%). Any applicant who fails to receive a passing grade may retake
the examination in the following calendar quarter, subject to refiling an
application and making payment of the examination fee as provided in Section
1321.06(d).
 
   (c)   The Board shall keep an accurate record of all applications for
examination and of the examinations given and of the results thereof for a
period of at least three years; and such records shall be open to public
inspection. If the Board of Telecommunications Examiners disapproves the
application for a license, the applicant may appeal to the City Licensing
Appeals Board as provided for in Chapter
149 of the City Administrative Code. The decision of the City Licensing Appeals
Board may be judicially reviewed by appeal to the Stark County Court of Common
Pleas in accordance with Ohio R.C. Chapters 2505 and 2506.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.09 LICENSE ISSUANCE; REVOCATION AND/OR SUSPENSION.
   (a)   Upon approval of an application for a telecommunications contractor's
license by the Examining Board, after the submission of a proper application
and satisfactorily passing the examination, the Electrical Inspector shall
issue to such applicant a license to engage in the business of
telecommunications contractor for the calendar year in which such application
was made.
 
   (b)   The City Chief Building Official may suspend or revoke the
telecommunications contractor's license issued to any person under this chapter
after due notice and opportunity for a fair hearing if the licensee fails to
comply with this chapter or the statutes of the State of Ohio or has been
guilty of gross neglect or misconduct or fails to maintain the qualifications
to perform the work of telecommunications contractor or is otherwise in
violation of the provisions of this chapter. Any person aggrieved by a decision
of the City Chief Building Official revoking or suspending a telecommunications
contractor's license, may appeal such decision to the Board of
Telecommunications Examiners by filing written notice of such appeal with the
City Chief Building Official and also with the Board of Telecommunications
Examiners within ten days after the decision is made. The Board of
Telecommunications Examiners shall, within fifteen days of the filing of such
appeal, conduct a hearing reviewing the suspension and/or revocation at which
the facts and circumstances of such suspension or revocation shall be reviewed;
and after which hearing the Board may affirm, reverse or modify such suspension
and/or revocation. The decision of the Board of Telecommunications Examiners
may be judicially reviewed by appeal to the Stark County Court of Common Pleas
in accordance with Ohio R.C. Chapters 2505 and 2506.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.10 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person shall install, alter, repair or replace telecommunications
wiring, devices or apparatus covered by this chapter without first obtaining a
telecommunications installation work permit for the proposed work from the City
Electrical Inspector, with the exception of performance of minor work such as
changing outlets, jacks or connectors, the insulating of bare joints, repairing
of drop cords and other similar work determined to be minor work within the
discretion of the City Chief Building Official.
 
   (b)   When requested by the City Chief Building Official/Plans Examiner, the
applicant for a telecommunications installation permit shall furnish plans and
specifications completely describing the work to be installed before a permit
will be issued.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.11 EXAMINATION OF PLANS.
   All plans and specifications which may be required by the City Chief
Building Official/Plans Examiner, to be submitted prior to issuance of a
permit, shall be examined by the City Chief Building Official/Plans Examiner
for acceptability under the provisions of this chapter and the City Electric
Code and the provisions of the National Electric Code pertaining to
telecommunications wiring. Fees for the processing and inspection of plans and
specifications shall be as follows:
   (a)   New Installation Plans. The processing and plans examination fee for
new installation shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00).
   (b)   Alterations and Repairs. There shall be no processing fee upon
submission of plans and a permit application for alteration or repair of
existing telecommunications installations. In the event that the submission of
plans is required by the City Chief Building Official/Plans Examiner for a
proposed telecommunications system alteration or repair, the processing and
plans examination fee shall be fifty cents ($0.50) per each one hundred square
feet of floor area being serviced by the proposed alterations or replacements.
   (c)   There shall be no fees charged for plans examinations made by the City
Chief Building Official/Plans Examiner for new or replacement
telecommunications installations with respect to one-, two- and three-family
residential dwellings.
   (d)   Upon written application to and approval by the City Safety Director,
the plans examinations fees and also the permit fees provided for under this
chapter may be waived with respect to any telecommunications installation or
wiring work proposed to be performed in or upon any State or local government
facility.
      (Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.12 PERMIT FEES.
   In addition to the foregoing processing and plans examination fees as set
forth in Section
1321.11, all applications for telecommunications wiring and installation
permits shall be accompanied by payment of the following permit and inspection
fees as set forth below:
 
(a)   Standard Permit Fee (includes one final inspectio$ 25.00
(b)   Any other requested inspection                   25.00
(c)   Reinspection fee for code violations             25.00
(d)   Additional inspection fees:
 (1)   Telecommunications outlet/receptacles          5.00
  (1-5 outlets/drops)
 (2)   Each additional outlet/drop (6-50 outlets/drops.25 per outlet
 (3)   Each additional outlet/drop                    .20 per outlet
  (over 50 outlets/drops)
   All of the foregoing shall be paid in full prior to issuance of the final
approval certificate with respect to the work performed.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.13 RECORDS.
   The City Electrical Inspector, as the person designated to inspect
telecommunications installation work in the City, shall keep complete records
of all permits issued and inspections made and other official work performed
under the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.14 LICENSE NONTRANSFERABLE.
   No telecommunications contractor's license issued under the authority of
this chapter shall be transferable by the license holder. If the person who
passed the licensing examination on behalf of the entity to whom the license
was issued ceases to be a member of the partnership or firm to which the
license is granted or ceases to be an officer of the corporation to which the
license is granted or becomes deceased, then the telecommunications
contractor's license shall be revoked. Should any telecommunications
contractor's license be revoked for such causes, the licensee nevertheless
shall be allowed ninety days for completion of any telecommunications contracts
started as of that date.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.15 INSPECTIONS.
   Upon completion of the telecommunications wiring work in any building, the
person, firm or corporation performing such work shall notify the City
Electrical Inspector, who shall inspect the installation within forty-eight
hours from the time such notice is given. If the installation work is found to
be in full compliance with all laws relating thereto and the requirements of
this chapter, and is found by the Inspector to be safe and proper, the
Inspector shall issue for delivery to the owner, a Certificate of Inspection
indicating the work to be in compliance with the National Electric Code and the
provisions of this chapter. All wiring and/or cable which is to be hidden from
view shall, wherever feasible, be inspected before concealment.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.16 ENTRY FOR INSPECTIONS.
   The City Electrical Inspector may enter upon private or public property,
including the improvements thereon, at any reasonable time for the purpose of
inspecting and/or reinspecting the installation of all telecommunication wiring
devices and apparatus, within the City. When the installation of such wiring
devices or apparatus is found to be defective, unsafe or otherwise improperly
installed, the person, firm or corporation owning, using or operating the same
shall be notified and ordered to make the repairs or changes necessary to bring
such installation into compliance with this chapter. The City Electrical
Inspector is hereby empowered to disconnect or order the discontinuance of
electrical service to any such wiring, devices and apparatus so found to be
defectively installed until the installation of such wiring devices and
apparatus have been brought into compliance with this code.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.17 METHODS AND MATERIALS.
   (a)   No Certificate of Inspection shall be issued unless the
telecommunications wiring, devices and apparatus have been installed and are in
strict conformity with the provisions of this chapter, the statutes of the
State of Ohio and any applicable rules and regulations issued by the Industrial
Commission of Ohio under authority of the State statutes and unless they are in
conformity with the most approved methods for the installation of
telecommunications wiring and equipment.
 
   (b)   For purposes of this chapter, the regulations as provided for in the
most recent edition of the National Electric Code (NFPA Vol. 70) as approved by
the American Standards Association and as adopted in the Ohio Building Code,
together with all amendments, supplements and interpretations of such codes,
shall be prima-facie evidence of the most approved methods.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.18 DUTIES OF ELECTRICAL INSPECTOR.
   It shall be the duty of the City Electrical Inspector to enforce the
provisions of this chapter. If a condition or circumstance exists or arises
which is not specifically provided for herein, the Electrical Inspector shall
prescribe the requirements necessary to make such work conform to the intent
and purposes hereof so that when installed, such work shall be proper and
reliable.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.19 COMPLIANCE AND VIOLATIONS.
   (a)   No person, firm or corporation shall install telecommunications
wiring, devices or apparatus in any building or make any addition, alteration
or replacement thereof, without complying with the requirements and provisions
contained in this chapter.
 
   (b)   No architect, builder, engineer, contractor, electrical contractor,
subcontractor or agent or employee or other person shall violate or assist in
violating any of the provisions contained in this chapter.
 
   (c)   No person, firm or corporation or employee or agent thereof, shall
hinder or obstruct in any manner or interfere with the City Chief Building
Official or Electrical Inspector in the performance of his duties under this
chapter or fail to comply with any lawful order of the Electrical Inspector
issued pursuant to the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)
1321.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree and shall be fined not more than two hundred
fifty dollars ($250.00) and imprisoned for not more than thirty days for each
offense. Each day of a continuing violation shall constitute a separate
offense.
(Ord. 221-92. Passed 11-16-92.)

CHAPTER 1331
Ohio Building Code
   EDITOR'S NOTE: There are no sections in this Chapter. It has been
established to provide a place for cross references and future legislation. The
City Building Department is certified by the Ohio Board of Building Standards
to exercise enforcement authority over all occupancies named in the Ohio
Building Code including one, two and three-family dwellings which are of
industrialized unit construction. The Ohio Building Code does not apply to one,
two and three-family dwellings which are not constructed of industrialized
units, but the City Residential Building Code codified in Chapter
1333 applies to such dwellings.

CHAPTER 1333
Residential Building Code
1333.01   Adoption.
 
1333.01 ADOPTION.
   The City approves and adopts the current edition of the Residential Code of
Ohio, and any additions or amendments thereto as may hereinafter be adopted and
promulgated by the Ohio Board of Building Standards, to be used to exercise
enforcement authority over all new construction of one-, two- and three-family
dwellings.
(Ord. 168-2006. Passed 9-25-06.)
CHAPTER 1335
Building Drains and Sewers
1335.01   Drainage over sidewalks prohibited.
1335.02   Manner of construction.
1335.03   Curb cuts under City Engineer.
1335.04   Spouting connections.
1335.05   Storm sewer connections under City Engineer.
1335.06   Roof drainage.
1335.07   Eave troughs to be constructed.
1335.08   Building sewers.
1335.09   Sanitary sewer connections under City Engineer.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Plumbing - see BLDG. Ch.
1315
 
1335.01 DRAINAGE OVER SIDEWALKS PROHIBITED.
   No person, being the owner, agent or person in charge or control of any
building within the City shall construct, maintain or permit to be constructed
or maintained on such building, any spouting, conductor or pipes through which
water, other liquids or steam shall drain or flow upon or over any public
sidewalk of the City. (Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1335.02 MANNER OF CONSTRUCTION.
   All spouting, conductors or pipes attached to any building for the purpose
of carrying off water, other liquids or steam, shall be constructed in such a
manner that the flow or drainage of such water, or through a metal tile or
other waterproof conductor laid under a sidewalk adjacent to such building,
into a gutter in the street. However, when any building is situated upon any
street, avenue or alley in which there is no storm water sewer or upon which
the sidewalk is not of sufficient height above the gutter in the street so that
a conductor can be built under the sidewalk, a concrete gutter may be
constructed across the sidewalk from the downspout on such building for the
purpose of carrying any water, other liquids or steam across the sidewalk into
the street.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1335.03 CURB CUTS UNDER CITY ENGINEER.
   Any opening or cutting through any curbing or sidewalk in the City by any
person, for the purpose of complying with any of the provisions hereof shall be
made under the direction and supervision of the City Engineer.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1335.04 SPOUTING CONNECTIONS.
   All spouting, conductors or pipes attached to any building hereafter erected
or constructed in the City, for the purpose of carrying off water, other
liquids or steam shall, if the street on which such building is located
contains a storm sewer, be connected direct with such storm water sewer; (Ord.
165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1335.05 STORM SEWER CONNECTIONS UNDER CITY ENGINEER.
   All connections with storm water sewers shall be made under the direction
and supervision of the City Engineer.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1335.06 ROOF DRAINAGE.
   All roof drainage from any building heretofore erected, any side of which
faces on a street having a storm water sewer therein and which is not connected
with a storm water sewer shall flow into or in the direction of such street
having a storm water sewer.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1335.07 EAVE TROUGHS TO BE CONSTRUCTED.
   Any person or persons, firms or corporation constructing or causing to be
constructed any buildings so near the line of any public street or alley in the
City, or any sidewalk on such street or alley or being the owner of any
building heretofore constructed, such person, persons or firms or the
president, manager or superintendent of such corporation shall forthwith upon
the completion of building, cause eave troughs or spouting to be placed along
the edge of eaves of such roof so overhanging such streets, alleys or sidewalk,
and connect the same with downspouting, all of such size and construction as
shall prevent any and all water from such roof from falling on such street,
alley or sidewalk and shall at all times, keep such eave troughs, spouting and
downspouting in proper repair. (Ord 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1335.08 BUILDING SEWERS.
   A separate and independent building sewer shall be provided for every
building, except where one building stands at the rear of another on an
interior lot and no private sewer is available or can be constructed to the
rear building through an adjoining alley, court, yard or driveway, the building
sewer from the front building may be extended to the rear building and the
whole considered as one building sewer, provided a recorded easement for use
and maintenance of such sewer is stated on application and the method of
installation meets the approval of the City Engineer. (Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-
16-69.)
 
1335.09 SANITARY SEWER CONNECTIONS UNDER CITY ENGINEER.
   No unauthorized person shall uncover, make any connection with or opening
into, use, alter or disturb any public sanitary sewer or appurtenance thereof
without first obtaining a written permit from the City Engineer.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
CHAPTER 1337
Swimming Pools
1337.01   Definitions.
1337.02   Construction permit and approval.
1337.03   Permit fee.
1337.04   Enclosure of swimming pool.
1337.05   Walkways.
 
1337.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)   "Public swimming pool" means an artificial body of water, with a
controlled water supply, used collectively by numbers of persons for swimming,
or recreative bathing, but not including family swimming pools or wading pools.
   (b)    "Family swimming pool" means an artificial body of water, with a
controlled water supply, over eighteen inches in depth or 200 square feet of
surface area, and used or intended to be used solely by the owner or lessee
thereof, and his family and by friends invited to use it without payment of any
fee.
      (Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-6-69.)
1337.02 CONSTRUCTION PERMIT AND APPROVAL.
   Before work is commenced on the construction of a public swimming pool or a
family swimming pool, or on any alteration, addition, remodeling or other
improvement thereto, an application for permit to construct and the plans and
specifications and pertinent explanatory data hereinafter required shall be
submitted to the Chief Building Official for approval, and no part of the work
shall be commenced until the Chief Building Official has evidenced his approval
by a suitable endorsement upon such plans and specifications, and has granted a
permit therefor.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1337.03 PERMIT FEE.
   The fee for the permit to construct, alter or remodel swimming pools shall
be twenty-five dollars ($25.00).
(Ord. 18-87. Passed 2-2-87.)
1337.04 ENCLOSURE OF SWIMMING POOL.
   Every outdoor swimming pool shall be completely surrounded by a fence not
less than five feet in height for public swimming pools, and not less than four
feet in height for family swimming pools, which shall be constructed so that
horizontal members are on the pool side of the enclosure and vertical members
shall not be spaced more than two inches apart. A building or existing wall may
be used as part of such enclosure. All gates or doors opening through such
enclosure shall be designed to permit locking and shall be kept locked when the
pool is not in actual use, or is left unattended.
   The requirements for fencing and gates shall apply to both new and existing
outdoor swimming pools having a maximum depth over eighteen inches, below
ground level except that owners of existing outdoor pools shall be given a
reasonable period, not to exceed one year from June 16, 1969, in which to
comply. No person in possession of land within the City, either as owner,
purchaser, lessee, tenant or a licensee, upon which is situated a swimming pool
having a maximum depth over eighteen inches shall fail to provide and maintain
such fence or wall as provided herein.
   The Chief Building Official may make modifications in individual cases, upon
showing good cause with respect to the height, nature or location of the fence,
gates or latches, or the necessity therefor, provided the protection as sought
hereunder is not reduced thereby. The Chief Building Official may permit other
protective devices or structures to be used so long as the degree of protection
afforded by the substitute devices or structures is not less than the
protection afforded by the wall, fence, gate and latch described herein.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1337.05 WALKWAYS.
   The pool shall be completely surrounded by a walkway at least three feet in
width which shall be drained away from the pool. The provisions contained in
this section shall not apply to existing swimming pools or swimming pools now
in the process of construction as of June 16, 1969. (Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-
69.)
CHAPTER 1339
Parking Lots
1339.01    Construction requirements.
 
1339.01 CONSTRUCTION REQUIREMENTS.
   Public and private parking lots shall be constructed as follows:
   (a)    Sub-base shall be a minimum of six inches compacted run-a-mine gravel
or No. 4 slag with binding.
   (b)    Asphalt concrete base shall be a minimum of three and one-half inches
compacted.
   (c)   Asphalt concrete surface or wearing course shall be a minimum of one
inch compacted.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
CHAPTER 1341
Fire Limits
1341.01   Limits designated.
1341.02   Erections within fire limits.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
State law provisions - see Ohio R.C. 737.28
Building inspection for fire and safety - see Ohio R. C. 737.34
 
1341.01 LIMITS DESIGNATED.
   The "fire limits" of the City shall embrace the territory included within
the following boundaries:
    Commencing at the intersection of 8th St. NW and High Ave. NW; thence
southwardly along the east line of High Ave. NW and High Ave. SW to the
intersection of High Ave. SW and 6th St. SW; thence eastwardly along the north
line of 6th St. SW and 6th St. SE to the intersection of 6th St. SE and
Savannah Ave. SE; thence northwardly in a direct line along the west line of
Savannah Ave. SE and Savannah Ave. NE and 9th St. NE; thence westwardly along
the south line of 9th St. NE to the intersection of 9th St. NE and Cherry Ave.
NE; thence northwardly along the west line of Cherry Ave. NE to the
intersection of Cherry Ave. NE and 12th St. NE; thence westwardly along the
south line of 12th St. NE and 12th St. NW to the intersection of 12th St. NW
and McKinley Ave. NW; thence southwardly along the east line of McKinley Ave.
NW to the intersection of McKinley Ave. NW and 8th St. NW; thence westwardly
along the south line of 8th St. NW to the intersection of 8th St. NW and High
Ave. NW, the place of beginning.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
1341.02 ERECTIONS WITHIN FIRE LIMITS.
   No person shall erect or construct any building or addition to any building
within the "fire limits" unless the following conditions are complied with:
Except as hereinafter provided, the walls shall be constructed of iron, steel,
brick, stone, reinforced concrete or a cement mixture commonly known as stucco,
laid entirely upon a backing of brick, tile, metal lath or other approved
noncombustible material. The roof deck shall be constructed of masonry,
reinforced concrete, burnt clay tile, gypsum, terra cotta or other approved
fire-proof materials, or of heavy wood sufficiently strong to safely bear the
load, all to be supported upon steel, reinforced concrete, masonry, or heavy
timber trusses, girders, beams or supports of sufficient strength to bear the
load.
   Finished roof covering shall be of tar and gravel, asbestos, tile, concrete,
cement, metal, slate or other approved noncombustible material. Buildings not
more than ten feet in height from the ground to the highest point of roof may
be built of wood which shall be covered on both roof and walls with metal or
other approved noncombustible material which may be laid upon a wood backing.
No building shall be erected in such a manner as to endanger the safety of the
foundations or superstructure of an adjoining building.
   The removal of any building contemplated herein from any place without the
territory described in Section
1341.01 to any place within the territory shall be held to be the erection of
such building within such territory.
(Ord. 165-69. Passed 6-16-69.)
CHAPTER 1343
Projecting Signs
1343.01   Definitions.
1343.02   Permit required and fee.
1343.03   Size and location.
1343.04   Attaching and supporting requirements.
1343.05   Hanging equipment requirements.
1343.06   Inspection.
1343.07   Construction; wind pressure.
1343.08   Unsafe or insecure signs.
1343.09   Signs and banners across streets; permit and fee. (Repealed)
1343.10   Removal of signs after discontinuance of business.
1343.11   Enforcement by Chief Building Official; sign removal.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Encroachments - see BLDG.
1345.01
 
1343.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)    "Projecting sign" means any letter, work, model, sign, device, or
representation used in the nature of advertisement, announcement or direction,
extending over the sidewalk beyond the property line at the street or alley
more than eighteen inches.
   (b)    “Electric signs” mean the bulb or neon type, and do not include box
glass, transparent or hooded or reflector types, commonly known as commercial
signs. (1964 Code §701.15)
1343.02 PERMIT REQUIRED AND FEE.
   No person who is the owner, lessee or custodian of a projecting sign, shall
erect or hang, or allow to be erected or hung, any such projecting sign without
first having obtained a permit from the Building Department. The Building
Department shall charge a fee for each permit, which shall be good for one sign
only. Nonelectric signs up to six square feet and temporary cloth signs, other
than those embraced in Section
1343.09, shall not require a permit. Such temporary cloth signs shall not be
left up over sixty days.
(1964 Code §701.16)
1343.03 SIZE AND LOCATION.
   No projecting sign shall project further than the inside of the curb line or
be less than eight feet above the sidewalk, nor project beyond the property
line at the street or alley more than six and one-half feet measured from the
property line of the street or alley at a point eight feet above the sidewalk,
except that such sign may project an additional two and one-half inches for
each additional foot of height above the sidewalk. However, in no case shall
such sign project more than eight and one-half feet beyond the property line at
the street or alley, nor further than the inside of the curb line. (1964 Code
§701.17)
1343.04 ATTACHING AND SUPPORTING REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Every projecting sign shall be securely attached to the building wall,
structure or suitable metal posts located within the lot lines by iron or metal
anchors, bolts, supports, chains, stranded cables or steel rods. The minimum
size cable for head and side guys or iron wire, number fourteen American
Standard, trade size. No such sign shall be supported from the street or
sidewalk.
   (b)   Nothing herein contained shall be deemed to prohibit the erection of a
sign on a lawnstrip which is at least eighteen feet in width, between the curb
and the nearest edge of the sidewalk, so long as such sign is a center-post
type, no larger than four feet in width by eight feet in height and so long as
the post is not less than eight feet distant from both the curb and the inside
edge of the sidewalk, and not less than twenty-five feet distant from the curb
of the nearest intersection street. (1964 Code § 701.18)
1343.05 HANGING EQUIPMENT REQUIREMENTS.
   Every projecting sign for which a permit is required by this chapter, shall
have hanging equipment in accordance with and meet the requirements of the
specifications on file in the Building Department. (1964 Code §701.19)
1343.06 INSPECTION.
   No projecting electric sign of any description shall be erected or hung
without having first been inspected or approved by the Chief Building Official
or his authorized deputies. It shall be the duty of the owner or user of such
electric signs to notify the Chief Building Official when such sign is ready
for the inspection, and no person shall erect or hang such sign until such
inspection or approval has been given and the permit required by Section
1343.02 has been issued.
(1964 Code §701.20)
1343.07 CONSTRUCTION; WIND PRESSURE.
   Every projecting electric sign shall be constructed of metal or other
equally noncombustible material, and shall be constructed and braced to
withstand a wind pressure of thirty pounds for every square foot of surface
exposed. (1964 Code §701.21)
1343.08 UNSAFE OR INSECURE SIGNS.
   Should any projecting sign, roof sign or any other kind of sign be or
become, insecure, in danger of falling or otherwise unsafe, the owner or the
person using or maintaining the sign, shall proceed at once to put such sign in
a safe and secure condition or remove the same.
(1964 Code §701.22)
1343.09 SIGNS AND BANNERS ACROSS STREETS; PERMIT AND FEE.
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1343.09 was repealed by Ordinance 54-2001, passed April 2, 2001.)
1343.10 REMOVAL OF SIGNS AFTER DISCONTINUANCE OF BUSINESS.
   (a)   No person who is the owner, user or custodian of any kind of sign
shall permit such sign or its supports to be suspended over public sidewalks or
public property longer than thirty days after the discontinuance of the
business at such location, or of such purpose which the sign had advertised.
   (b)   If the owner, user or custodian of a sign suspended over public
sidewalks or public property fails to remove such sign within the allotted
thirty days after such business or purpose has been discontinued, then the
owner of the building or lessee of that part of the building or property, to
which such sign is attached, shall immediately remove such sign.
(1964 Code §701.24)
1343.11 ENFORCEMENT BY CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL; SIGN REMOVAL.
   It shall be the duty of the Chief Building Official to enforce the
provisions of this chapter, and he is hereby authorized and directed to remove
or order the removal of all signs hereafter erected in violation of this
chapter, signs that are insecure, in danger of falling or otherwise unsafe, and
all signs where the business or purpose of same has been discontinued.
(1964 Code §701.25)
CHAPTER 1345
Encroachments, Awnings and Canopies
1345.01   Encroachments prohibited; exceptions.
1345.02   Erection of awnings.
1345.03   Erection of canopies and marquees.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Projecting signs - see BLDG. Ch.
1343
 
1345.01 ENCROACHMENTS PROHIBITED; EXCEPTIONS.
   No person shall encroach upon or in any way obstruct or occupy any street,
alley, sidewalk, public ground or land dedicated to public use by placing,
building or erecting or causing to be placed, built or erected in, upon or over
such street, alley, sidewalk, public ground or land dedicated to public use,
any fence, building or structure of any kind whatever, or permit the same to
remain when placed, built or erected. However, nothing herein shall prevent
signs, awnings and canopies constructed, erected and maintained in accordance
with the provisions of the City ordinances. (1964 Code §519.08)
1345.02 ERECTION OF AWNINGS.
   Every awning hereafter set up, erected or maintained over any sidewalk in
the City shall be elevated at least seven feet at the lowest part thereof above
the sidewalk. Awnings so constructed as to swing with their frames against the
building, may project over the sidewalk, not to exceed two-thirds of the width
of the sidewalk. Fixed iron awning frames may project not to exceed eight feet
over the sidewalk from the inner sidewalk line. Every awning placed or
maintained over any sidewalk shall be supported without posts, by iron brackets
or proper iron hinges or pivots, with an iron framework firmly attached to the
building against which such awning is placed, which framework shall be so made
as to swing with such awning against the building. The sidewalk shall be wholly
unobstructed thereby. No wooden, or nonmovable awning, awning frame, shed or
cover shall be erected or permitted to remain on or over any sidewalk, and no
article or merchandise, poster or other article shall be attached to or
suspended from any awning or awning frame extending over any sidewalk, nor
shall any sign be attached thereto, except such signs as may be printed or
painted upon such awning.
(1964 Code §519.09)
1345.03 ERECTION OF CANOPIES AND MARQUEES.
   (a)   A canopy or marquee extending over a sidewalk may be erected and
maintained at the entrance of any hotel, church, hall, theater or other edifice
where public assemblages of people occur, subject to the following conditions.
Any such canopy or marquee shall in no case extend, further than the curbstone
in front of such building. It shall not have any of its parts or supports
resting upon the sidewalk or street. It shall be at least nine feet in the
clear above the sidewalk, and shall not be more than four feet high from its
lowest to its highest point.
   (b)   Before any canopy or marquee is erected, application for permission to
do so, accompanied with the plans thereof, shall be filed with the Chief
Building Official by the owner of the building to which it is attached. Upon
the Chief Building Official being satisfied that it is in conformity with this
section and will not imperil the public, a permit shall be issued for the
erection and maintenance thereof, conditioned that the applicant will save the
City harmless from any damage to persons or property by reason of the erection
or maintenance of such canopy or marquee, and that the same will be removed at
any time upon sixty days' notice from the Chief Building Official to do so.
(1964 Code §519.10)
